content.rendered:
FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE

XR Pioneers and Leaders Pack All-Star WebXR Business Summit

New York, NY – Tuesday, September 7, 2021– The XR Industry is rallying around WebXR for an all-day free virtual event, the WebXR Business Summit on September 14th, for  decision-makers to elevate their game onto the Immersive Web. The team that produced The Polys – WebXR Awards and the WebXR Developer Summit is back with a program hosted by Samantha Mathews, CEO/CTO of LOCI, featuring a roster of pioneers and business leaders to discuss the next evolution of the Internet.

WebXR delivers Virtual and Augmented Reality experiences on the open web, making it easy for developers to deploy spatial websites to new immersive stereoscopic 3D headsets, while still supporting billions of 2D mobile and desktop browsers. The WebXR Business Summit will focus on the opportunities and economics of this new medium. Mobile devices, social media, and video transformed the web over the past decade, serving billions of people and creating trillions in wealth, and immersive content is what’s next. 

The WebXR Business Summit features luminaries in the space from around the world, including Alban Denoyel, CEO of Sketchfab, which was recently acquired by Epic Games, maker of Unreal Engine and the popular game Fortnite. CEO Artur Sychov of Somnium Space will present live from his WebXR platform, which is establishing a creator economy around NFTs and virtual real-estate. Gabriel Baker, Poly Award Winner for Developer of the Year and Product Manager for Virbela’s FRAME platform, will talk about virtual events for the education, government, and private sectors in a feature interview with Sophia Moshasha. The panels are moderated by and stacked with prominent industry figures including Tony Parisi of Unity Technologies; Alan Smithson of MetaVRse; Timmu Tõke, CEO of popular avatar platform Ready Player Me; Jamie Burke of Outlier Ventures; and Tom Emrich of 8th Wall.  The day will be co-hosted by Julie Smithson, MetaVRse co-founder, XR Women Global Chair, and host of The Polys – WebXR Awards. For a the full agenda and list of speakers participating at the event visit https://webxr.events/event/webxr-business-summit/ 

Now that Apple has declared that support for the W3C’s Device API specification is in development and integrated into  its to-be-released browser engine WebKit, there is a push to make the specification a standard. Dr. June Wang, SVP at Futurewei Technologies Inc., the event’s lead sponsor, will host a panel called “Building Consensus Around Industry Standards” that features Neil Trevett, President of The Khronos Group, which created the WebGL, GTLF, and OpenXR standards used by WebXR. Another panel will discuss the business implications of initiatives to make the Metaverse interoperable. Special edition extended interviews with W3C’s Dominique Hazaël-Massieux and Neil Trevett will take a deeper dive into the standards topic help provide additional context for the summits.

The 2021 WebXR Summit Series will conclude on October 12th with the WebXR Design Summit, hosted by Kent Bye of the Voices of VR podcast, which will onboard creatives into the spatial and experiential medium. The Summits are streamed live on YouTube, Twitch, LinkedIn, and Facebook, and can be enjoyed as a community through a “Meta-Multiverse” of watch parties in VR Platforms including Frame, VRLand, AltSpaceVR, and ENGAGE. The WebXR Summit Series is sponsored by Futurewei Technologies Inc., and advocates for Open Source, Standardization, and Collaboration within the XR Ecosystem. 

The Polys – WebXR Awards and WebXR Summit Series is produced by Point Cloud Productions: Karen Alexander, Steve Lewis, Sophia Moshasha, Linda Ricci and Julie Smithson and created by Ben Erwin. The 2nd Polys – WebXR Awards ceremony will be held on February 12, 2022, with host Julie Smithson and Virtual Red Carpet host Sophia Moshasha. 

Contact: Sophia Moshasha
sophia@thevrara.com

title.rendered: The Polys – WebXR Awards Show Returns To Break More Ground

content.rendered:
The Polys WebXR Awards Show Returns To Break More Ground

FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE

New York, NY – February 11, 2022; The Polys – WebXR Awards returns Saturday, February 12, 2022 to celebrate the pioneers of the Immersive Web. The Virtual Red Carpet with Sophia Moshasha begins at 2pm Eastern followed by the ceremony, hosted by Julie Smithson. WebXR is the next evolution of the web, allowing accessibility to immersive content and world from any 2D or XR device. This awards show will celebrate pioneers and projects building on this new medium. The Polys – WebXR Awards breaks new ground as the first awards show to:

  • Broadcast the show to and from watch parties in virtual worlds
  • Demonstrate LIVE inter-platform traversing without breaking immersion from VR Land to the XR Women Museum in Frame
  • Have a live halftime show presented by OnboardXR with live singing and mocap dance in WebXR featuring Unwired Dance Theater’s Clemence Debaig, Brendan Bradley, Michael Morran, Maurice Soque Jr., and Christina Karpodini.
  • An After Party in Meta Horizons with a bespoke world created and hosted by Paige Danzinger.

With the innovations this show brings to blend live & virtual production in the metaverse, The Polys has made its name as “the next Emmys” for this new, emerging medium as Emmy winner and Polys’ nominee, Thomas Wallner, describes in this year’s trailer.

This year, The Polys is adding six new awards for a total of seventeen. The new categories are World, Video Experience, Augmented Reality Experience, Creator of the Year, Software of the Year, and the R.O.X. Award – Return on Experience, and a new Community Honor. Winners will be presented with their NFT trophies by an all-star lineup of personalities from the community. 

In order to qualify, nominated experiences must be stereoscopic immersive content that runs on the WebXR Device API. Visit The Polys website to experience nominated projects.

Special honorees include:

  • Lifetime Achievement Award – Brandon Jones, for his contributions to the WebXR Stack.
  • Ombudsperson of the Year – Avi Bar-Zeev for his philosophical contributions to the shaping of the Metaverse, presented by last year’s recipient, Kent Bye.
  • The first Community Honor – Trevor Flowers for his work supporting the W3C Community Group, editor of the Immersive Web Weekly newsletter, and host of the WebXR Developer Summit.

Register for the event here!

The WebXR Summit Series returns in 2022 with three all-new shows: the WebXR Education Summit hosted by Karen Alexander on July 21st, the WebXR Brand Summit hosted by Sophia Moshasha on September 15th, and the WebXR Production Summit hosted by Steve Lewis on October 13th. Futurewei Technologies, sponsors of the 2021 WebXR Summit Series, returns as the lead sponsor for this year’s Polys and Summit Series.

About the Team

The team behind the WebXR Summit series, producers Karen Alexander, Steve Lewis, and Linda Ricci, along with Polys hosts Julie Smithson and Sophia Moshasha and creator Ben Erwin. They produced 10 WebXR events in 2021 to include the first Polys show and movie premiere party, the WebXR Developer Summit hosted by Trevor Flowers, the WebXR Business Summit hosted by Samantha Mathews and the WebXR Design Summit hosted by Kent Bye. 

The team also collaborates on other projects, including the annual VR Charity Golf Tournament Ready Player Golf with Richard Ward, Chris Madsen, Sophia Moshasha and Ben Erwin. Julie Smithson, Sophia Moshasha, and Karen Alexander are co-founders of XR Women, which produced 50 weekly events in their first year.

title.rendered: The WebXR Education Summit Assembles Leaders in Immersive Education

content.rendered:
FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE

New York, NY – July 19, 2022 –  The WebXR Summit Series returns on Thursday, July 21st, for its fourth Edition, the WebXR Education Summit hosted by Dr. Karen Alexander. This 9-hour virtual event will have 22 sessions with featuring over 50 experts in immersive learning, representing top schools and companies that are building curricula and educational technology for the era of the Metaverse. 

Education is a key use for immersive technology, drawing investment from enterprise and academia to create next generation experiences that accelerate learning. This summit will convene practitioners who are innovating with new technologies to shape education for today’s world and tomorrow’s future. As our culture and society change, often as a result of technological advances, education must keep pace, and the speakers at this summit are helping to lead the way. This moment presents a key opportunity to develop new tools, methods, contexts, and concepts that will expand how we learn and deliver educational content more effectively. 

Decades of research have determined that immersive technology delivers improved outcomes. That core value is the foundation of this burgeoning industry. Market research reports unanimously predict rapid growth in the educational technology sector. This movement is creating vast opportunities for those investing in learning innovation across all sectors. Availability of lower cost equipment, new software, and high speed internet connections have put the infrastructure in place. Now it’s time to focus on building.

Since the term “Metaverse” became popularized, much discussion has been focused on “what” the Metaverse is. The 2022 WebXR Summit Series is focused on “the how” of building the Metaverse. By convening the pioneers who are already working on it, it aims to inspire the many people it will take to fulfill its promise. 

The WebXR Education Summit is a 9-hour virtual event with a long list of distinguished educators and entrepreneurs who will share their insights on what needs to happen next. Faculty from 17 renowned colleges and universities including Arizona State, Harvard, Stanford, and specialists from enterprise companies implementing solutions including Siemens, Schell Games, and Victory XR will be taking part. Robust discussions on topics ranging from research, administration, assessment, accessibility compliance, gamification, immersive teaching tools, and liberal arts to mitigating the next digital divide, which will provide the audience broad context to understand the coming disruption to traditional education modalities. 

The WebXR Education Town Hall will precede the summit on Thursday, July 14th with a two-hour public Zoom call to hear directly from the community. Anyone interested in immersive education is invited to participate by asking questions and sharing their experiences. This will help inform the discussion at the summit. Last year, the WebXR Summit Series had town halls before each of its three events, the Developer, Business, and Design Summits. 

Dr. Alexander’s experience spans partnering with community organizations to empower children and youth to create with XR tools, guiding higher-ed institutions through the process of XR adoption, advising ed tech and XR startups. She is a co-founder of XR Women, a worldwide network of professionals that meet weekly in virtual worlds and where a distinguished list of XR industry speakers has appeared. She has worked with some of the most influential thought leaders in spatial computing and is a member of the Immersive Learning Research Network’s State of XR and Immersive Learning Expert Panel. Prior to her work in XR, Dr. Alexander was Dean of Junior and Senior Year programs at the women’s college at Rutgers University and Senior Editor of Signs: Journal of Women and Culture in Society.

The WebXR Summit Series is co-hosted by Julie Smithson and features case-study interviews by Special Correspondent Sophia Moshasha, also co-founders of XR Women. Together, they also host The Polys – WebXR Awards and Virtual Red Carpet. A staple of the WebXR Summits and The Polys, created by Ben Erwin, are live community watch parties in multiple worlds across the “Meta-Multiverse,” on the Altspace, ENGAGE, Hubs, Frame, and VR Land platforms. Recently, Moshasha and Smithson led a cast of 17, including Dr Alexander, in “MetaTr@versal – A Day in the Life,” a play about humanity in the Metaverse with themes of standards and interoperability, written and directed by Ben Erwin with Terry xR. Schussler, at the Augmented World Expo. 

Sophia Moshasha will host the WebXR Brand Summit on September 15th, for discussions of immersive advertising and marketing. The 2022 Summit Series will conclude with the WebXR Production Summit hosted by Daniel Dyboski-Bryant on October 13th to discuss technical solutions to producing immersive experiences.

For update event roster visit https://webxr.events/event/webxr-education-summit/ 

Register for the WebXR Education Summit https://bit.ly/WebXREdSummitTix 

Register for the WebXR Education Town Hall https://bit.ly/WebXREducationSummitTownHall 

YouTube https://www.youtube.com/c/WebXRSummitSeries 

Twitter @WebXRAwards

Facebook Group https://www.facebook.com/groups/webxrawards 

The WebXR Summit Series and The Polys – WebXR Awards are sponsored in part by Futurewei Technologies. 

WebXR Education Summit Agenda and Roster

(Times listed are Eastern Daylight Time)

11:00 am | Welcome to the WebXR Education Summit

Summits creator Ben Erwin welcomes the audience, looks ahead to the great lineup of speakers on immersive education, and introduces host Dr. Karen Alexander.

• Ben Erwin – Creator, The Polys – WebXR Awards, WebXR Summit Series and MetaTr@versal @powersimple

11:05 am | Opening Remarks

Dr. Karen Alexander set the context and scope of presentations on Immersive Education and addresses the role of WebXR as an enabler for accelerated development of accessible XR programs.

• Karen Alexander – Host, WebXR Education Summit @XRconnectED

11:15 am | Morning Fireside Chat

Interview

• Karen Alexander – Host, WebXR Education Summit @XRconnectED

• Mina Johnson – Associate Professor, Arizona State University

11:45 am | The Metaversity Project

The Metaversity project led by Victory XR is a program of 10 Universities building digital twins in the Metaverse; West Virginia University, Morehouse College, Online California State University-Dominguez Hills, Florida A&M University, University of Kansas School of Nursing, University of Maryland Global Campus, SDSU Global Campus, New Mexico State University, Alabama A&M University College of Business and Public Affairs, and Southwestern Oregon Community College. Steve Grubbs shares with us the details of this pioneering initiative in an effort to inspire other schools to expand into immersive education.

Presentation

• Steve Grubbs – CEO, Victory XR @SteveGrubbsVXR

12:00 pm | State of Immersive Learning with XR

The Immersive Learning Research Network annually convenes a panel of experts to produce the State of XR and Immersive Learning Report. Leaders of this initiative discuss highlights of the 2022 report in progress.

Panel

• Karen Alexander – Host, WebXR Education Summit @XRconnectED

• Jonathon Richter – President and CEO, Immersive Learning Research Network (iLRN) @wainbrave

• Chris Dede – Professor, Harvard University @chrs_dede

• Maya Georgieva – Sr. Director, Innovation Center, The New School @mayaig

12:30 pm | Empowering Teachers with XR Tools

In this practice-focused panel, leading XR educators discuss the most effective tools available for use in the classroom and how teachers can employ them in lessons.

Panel

• Paula McDowell – Assistant Professor & Acting Department Head, U Saskatchewan @paulamacdowell

• Kai Frazier – Founder & CEO, Kai XR @__Ka1

• Steven Bambury – Founder, VirtualiTeach @steve_bambury

• Corinne Brenner – Director of Learning, Killer Snails @KillerSnails1

1:00 pm | Transforming Education in Africa

The African continent is rich in opportunities to build new educational models from the ground up and to prepare its young and growing population for a future in which XR is a primary computing platform. Experts from the continent will talk about their initiatives and key considerations.

Panel

• Arome Ibrahim – Co-Founder / 360VR Developer, Experis Immersive @aromeibrahim_

• Grace Kebirungi – Technical Project Coordinator, Infectious Diseases Institute (IDI) @GraceKebirungi2

• Walid Kilonzi – Virtual Reality Producer, Fallohide @Walid_Kilonzi

• Isiaq Gbadamosi – Co-Founder, Head of Growth, SwiftXR @IsiaqGbadamosi

• Job Oyebisi – CEO, Co-Founder, StanLab @joboyebisi

1:30 pm | Championing the Arts & Humanities in Tech-Enabled Education

XR education is not all about STEM. In fact, the affordances of XR make it highly effective for teaching arts and humanities. Experienced educators talk about how they have adopted XR to teach these subjects.

Panel

• Carlos J. Ochoa Fernandez – Founder, One Digital Consulting @CarlosJOchoaFer

• Nyambura M. Waruingi – Founder & Creative Director, AKOIA & Company @nyambura_mw

• Lucia Binotti – Professor, University of North Carolina Chapel Hill @lbinotti

• Michael McDonald – Project Manager – Custom Programs, SDA Bocconi Learning Lab @goldlotusco

2:00 pm | Assessing Learning for the Age of XR

New learning tools require new means of assessment. And XR permits the collection of data that encompasses much more than was previously possible.

Presentation

• Jennifer Rogers – Executive Officer, Learning Technology Standards Committee, IEEE @PeopleXLR8r

2:15 pm | Enabling Different Abilities with XR Content

Immersive learning can unlock potential for Special Education and people with different abilities, such as autism or those with mobility and cognitive impairments. The panel of experts explore success stories of how XR empowers those left behind in traditional education.

Panel

• Muhsinah Morris – Director of Morehouse in the Metaverse, Morehouse College https://www.twitter.com/drmuhsinah

• Jasmine Clark – Digital Scholarship Librarian, Temple University @lellyjz

• Anna Xygkou – PhD Researcher, University of Kent @anna_ksigou

2:45 pm | ADA Compliance for Immersive Education

Government funding for education comes with a mandate for accessibility. Failure to account for the needs of the differently abled could potentially expose institutions to lawsuits. Roland Dubois, a leading educator on WebXR and accessibility shares what you need to know to make sure your program serves the needs of everyone in compliance with governmental regulation.

Presentation

• Roland Dubois – Adjunct Faculty for XR, UX/UI, School of Visual Arts @rolanddubois

3:00 pm | Equity in Teaching Next Gen XR Developers

Presentation

• Rebecca DuPont  Associate Professor of Multimedia Communications, Community College of Allegheny County @Hoshiharetsu

3:15 pm | Administering XR Programs

As metaversities spring up and XR is increasingly adopted for education, policies, processes, and even organizational structures need to adapt to meet the opportunities and address new challenges. Here we examine actionable steps in constructing successful XR programs.

Panel

• Karen Alexander – Host, WebXR Education Summit @XRconnectED

• Jeremy Nelson – Director of XR Initiative, University of Michigan @jernel_Umich

• Emily Sherwood – Director, Digital Scholarship & Studio X, Studio X, University of Rochester @emilygwynne

• Heather Haseley – Co-Executive Director, Learning Futures, Arizona State University @hhaseley

3:30 pm | Gamification and Instructional Design for Immersive Learning

Design is key for all learning, and immersive learning is no exception. And gamification represents one strategy that can provide structure and enhance engagement in learning. This session explores immersive learning design strategies and why they matter.

Panel

• Heather Dodds – Senior XR Immersive Learning Researcher, Heather Elizabeth Dodds PhD Consulting @Heatherlovessci

• Aleshia Hayes – Assistant Professor of Learning Technologies, University of North Texas @AleshiaProf

• Brooke Morrill – Sr. Director of Education, Schell Games

• Stylianos Mystakidis – Learning Innovator, University of Patras @stylianosm2

4:00 pm | XR in Medical Education

Medical training is one of the most important use cases in XR, because it allows practitioners to learn in 3D, and practice without the stakes of operating on live patients or cadavers. Also, operating medical machines through immersive learning programs is more effective and economical than traditional 2D Models. Hear from leading experts in immersive medical education.

Panel

• Shawna Pandya – Vice President of Immersive Medicine, Luxsonic Technologies Inc. @shawnapandya

• Christi Fenison – XR Instructional Media Producer, UNC School of Medicine IT; XR World Builder -Cause + Christi; @christifenison

• William P. Levin, MD – Assoc Professor or Radiation Oncology & Medical Director of Global Network Operations, Penn Medicine, University of Pennsylvania Health System

4:30 pm | Bringing Immersive Education to Underserved Communities

“The Digital Divide” hasn’t been solved yet to provide equitable access to the internet, let alone immersive education. This panel will explore what it will take to accelerate the equitable delivery of Immersive Education to the underprivileged communities so that teachers and students have the access, exposure, and opportunity to take advantage of the best of today’s tools.

Panel

• Clayton Banks – CEO, Silicon Harlem @embertime

• Shannon Putman – PhD Researcher, University of Louisville @shannon1_putman

• Angelina Dayton – Tech Policy Fellow, The Aspen Institute @AngelinaDayton

5:00 pm | Building Community Among XR Educators

Co-founders of Educators in VR Lorelle von Fossen and Daniel Dyboski-Bryant have extensive experience bringing people together in VR to share their knowledge and experience of  XR education. Here they will discuss what they have gleaned from the hundreds of events they’ve produced.

Panel

• Daniel Dyboski-Bryant – Executive Director, Virtual World Society http://twitter.com/educatorsvr

• Lorelle Van Fossen – Director, Educators in VR http://twitter.com/educatorsvr

• Emilie Joly – CEO, Zoe Immersive @ZoeImmersive

5:30 pm | Afternoon Fireside Chat

• Karen Alexander – Host, WebXR Education Summit @XRconnectED

6:00 pm | Teaching in Virtual Campuses and Classrooms

When the rules of time and physics don’t apply, you can teach anywhere at any moment in history and take the students with you. We’ll hear from teachers who are also world builders on what they’ve learned while teaching in VR.

Panel

• Keith Chan – Professor of Anthropology, MiraCosta College @chekeichan

• Michael Avis – Faculty Facilitator & Educational Technology Coach | Founder & President, George Brown College | Tapvigo

• Andrew Wright – Creator, The EDUmetaverse @EduMetaverse

6:30 pm | Adaptive Transformation

Summit co-host Julie Smithson will synthesize what we learned today, and talk about building digital mindsets in organizations. There is enormous potential to transform the world of work with XR. That starts with how people learn to do their jobs, upskill for further opportunities.

Panel

• Julie Smithson – Co-Founder, MetaVRse Inc. @juliesmithso

7:00 pm | Findings on the Effectiveness of XR for Education

The evidence for the effectiveness of XR in learning is more than anecdotal. These researchers represent the cutting edge of those whose work can show us what really works.

Panel

• Karen Alexander – Host, WebXR Education Summit @XRconnectED

• Cassondra Eng – Researcher, Stanford University

• Eleni Mangina – VP, International Science, University College Dublin @elenimangina

7:30 pm | Enterprise Case Study: Siemens Healthineers

International medical appliance manufacturer Siemens Healthineers are remaking their employee education program using MetaVRse Engine. Sophia meets with Jennifer Crawford to talk about how the scalability of WebXR enables rapid expansion with measurable results.

Interview

• Sophia Moshasha – Special Correspondent, WebXR Summit Series @SophiaMosh

• Jennifer Crawford – Global Head of Education Designers, Siemens Healthineers

7:45 pm | Classroom Case Study – The Magic of Flight

The Magic of Flight swept its categories at the Poly Awards including Education Experience of the Year. Sophia Moshasha interviews John Collins, who has more than 30 years experience in STEM education, on the difference that immersive makes.

Interview

• Sophia Moshasha – Special Correspondent, WebXR Summit Series @SophiaMosh

• John Collins – The Paper Airplane Guy, @pprairplnguy

content.rendered:
The MetaTr@versal Initiative is an independent advocacy fellowship that holds events designed to foster cooperation between the stakeholders of the Metaverse.

MetaTr@versal began in 2021 with a series of Zoom calls among industry leaders to express support for portal interoperablility across social XR platforms. This was followed up with a special 2-hour panel event, followed by a three-act play performed on the Main Stage at AWE in June of 2022. MetaTr@versal holds portal crawls between platforms to demonstrate the need for interoperability.

Founding Fellow Neil Trevett credits MetaTr@versal as being instrumental in the founding of the Metaverse Standards, which he chairs.

MetaTr@versal is created by Ben Erwin with founding Fellows Evo Heyning, Terry xR. Schussler, Neil Trevett, Daniel Dyboski-Bryant and Julie Smithson.

content.rendered:
Championing XR Industry Advancement through Leadership, Collaboration, and Innovation

As the creator of The Polys – WebXR Awards, WebXR Summit Series, and MetaTr@versal, Ben Erwin has made a lasting impact on the XR industry by catalyzing awareness and engagement with the immersive web. With over three decades of experience as an internet frontiersman, he has been instrumental in advancing the industry through the recognition of its pioneers and providing advocacy platforms for thought leaders.

Ben’s diverse background includes serving as a developer and executive for digital media agencies, where he created data-driven interactives for numerous major brands. In addition, he dedicated 13 years as a webmaster and consultant for the United Nations humanitarian section and partner NGOs, raising awareness for women and children in conflict areas worldwide.

A digital polymath, Ben’s expertise spans marketing, management, programming, video editing, and writing. His experience in the browser wars led him to collaborate with XR industry leadership in producing the MetaTr@versal series of events. These gatherings galvanize the community around cooperation on the development and adoption of open standards and platform interoperability for the Metaverse.

Passionate about the potential of immersive content as a positive means for evolved human communication in areas like civics, journalism, and education, Ben shines a light on innovators’ good works to preserve their legacy and inspire others to build upon it.

With a network of over 10,500 LinkedIn followers and 9,500 connections, Ben Erwin exemplifies dedication to the XR industry’s growth, championing its advancement through leadership, collaboration, and innovation.

content.rendered:
Julie Smithson’s personal mission is to ‘inspire and educate people to think and act in a socially, economically and environmentally responsible way’.

It is through this lens as co-founder at MetaVRse, a 3D Web game engine for Business & XR development company.  Julie is leading enterprise companies to digitally transform and educate ways to immersive and remotely train users of the product/service. Julie guides her team to translate instructional language, interaction behaviors and curate knowledge testing gamification for businesses.  

Julie’s leadership is focused on transforming training & marketing into immersive experiences using technologies to design Web3 solutions, integration implementation and deployment to produce growth benefits, cost savings and human efficiencies.

Julie is also co-Chair of XRWomen.com , a global group of women who meet every Wednesday and learn about the applications of extended realities.  The group works to advocate, inspire and build communities aimed at inclusivity of gender equality, race and ethnicity in the digital sector and beyond.  

Julie is the host of the XR For Learning podcast. Julie also leads XR Collaboration, a coalition supporting human connectivity through digital presence in platforms building communication and collaboration.  Julie is also founder of XR Ignite to support the innovation and entrepreneurship of our communities. She also sits on panels and in leading conversations about interoperability standards and alignments with Khronos Group and MetaTr@versal.  

Previous to MetaVRse, Julie was Co-Founder of Emulator, the World’s most advanced DJ system, which won the prestigious 2011 DJ Mag Innovative Product Award.  She scored a $500K deal on the hit TV show Dragons’ Den. 

Julie is the co-host of the WebXR Summit series and a renowned speaker on XR and Produced TEDx Toronto (2010) and introduced coding in VR at Canada Learns Code (2017). She is past-President of the VRARA Toronto Chapter and Former Chair of the VRARA Education and Student Committees. Most recently Julie presented with the YPO, Harvard and 1Society about changing the way we learn and teach using spatial technologies.

Evo Heyning has been creating immersive experiences that bridge real and virtual worlds for more than 20 years. As an interactive showrunner and production strategist, she has worked on media projects ranging from launching the Affordable Care Act to producing more than 500 hours of livestreaming events during the pandemic. Her work focuses on metaverse media and the creative potential of volumetric and virtual production.

Evo passionately shapes the future of the open spatial web to connect people and groundbreaking, applicable ideas through collaborative technologies. Through her company Playable Agency, Evo provides early stage production strategy and creative worldbuilding that expand reality.

content.rendered:
LISI LINARES is the founder of LNRS PR+ XR TLNT MNGMNT, a boutique publicity and talent management agency that operates in stealth mode. All of the clients come word of mouth.

VR has been Lisi’s passion since she wrote her first VR script at NYU Film in 1994. Too early to start a career in VR, Lisi began making music. She recorded and released songs with influential label, Ze Records. Her music attracted the casting agent for SURVIVOR. She went on to appear as a castaway on season 14. Doing press junkets for CBS lead to a pointing point. “I really got into how a story is pitched and how the narrative of a character is shaped in the media”

In 2015, Lisi co-founded a public relations agency representing primarily Crypto and Blockchain projects. After premiering the first Anime on the blockchain, Vevara in Your Dream and working with some of the bigger projects in the space such as David Chaum’s Elixxir, Path Network and NGRAVE, it was time to move on.
During the summer of 2019 Lisi saw an opportunity to pivot into VR, the great love of her life! Starting with consulting AR start-ups, she quickly became immersed in the XR community. “I feel like I had found my tribe.”

March 2021, Lisi expanded her publicity services to include managing xr talent. She is actively bridging the gap between 20th and 21st century entertainment. Consulting talent agencies on how to prepare their talent roster was the inspiration behind XR TLNT MNGMNT.
Lisi is a proud Board Member of the Femme Futures Grant at Artizen and XR Women.

Stay tuned more to come…

content.rendered:
Jonathan (Jono) Brandel is an award winning graphic designer and computer programmer. He comes from mixed heritage, an American of Filipino and Polish descent. As such Jono pairs distinct subjects to frame the creative process. These combinations range from latin and emojis to lithography and pixel sorting. While pairings vary, there is an accessible tenor to the digital and physical objects he produces. This attention to detail allows people to access complex subject matters including positivism, the collision of black holes, and music composition with ease.

With a Bachelor’s in Design | Media Arts, a Minor in Latin from the University of California, Los Angeles, and a Master of Fine Arts in New Media from Paris College of Art, Jono’s work has been shown at international festivals including TED, Sundance, Tribeca Film Festival, SIGGRAPH, and the Japan Media Arts Festival. His commitment to Visual Music has sparked collaborations with musicians including applications with Lullatone, a live performance with Nosaj Thing, and interactive music videos for the likes of Matthew Dear, the Chemical Brothers, and Kimbra.
To develop his projects Jono writes custom software and actively participates in open source communities. He shares his own libraries such as the event driven two-dimensional drawing interface for the web, Two.js. This library and many others are freely available and actively maintained to help promote the creative expression of individuals worldwide.

Dr. Chan has always been interested in technology and finding new ways to use it in education, especially WebXR.

Back in 2014 Raanan had made his first contribution to Babylon.js – the web 3D engine. Since then he has continuously contributed to the open source framework as a community member. For the last year he has been working as a software developer @ Microsoft in the Babylon.js team. A major part of his time is invested in developing and maintaining Babylon’s WebXR support. The rest of the time he is trying to configure build systems, fight React, and catch up on E-Mails.

He resides in Berlin, Germany, and enjoys playing multiplayer games with his family, making music, and practicing magic tricks that get him nowhere.

meta.blurb:
This talk is about Babylon.js and its WebXR support. We will talk about the engine itself, the principals that guide us, and the way we see WebXR support and the decisions made when implementing it - simplicity, extensibility, and full support for advanced devs. 
We will see a few XR demos, see the tools the framework provides, talk a bit about Babylon native (cross-platform application development) and go over a few code snippets.
Satisfaction guarantied or your money back!

content.rendered: Keram founded both VRTO & FIVARS in 2015. He’s a business and creative development consultant to a wide variety of tech companies, and founder of Constant Change Media Group Inc., with strong ties to both the Toronto & Los Angeles markets. He is also the editor in-chief of IndieGameReviewer.com, an instructor in WebXR design at UCLA Extension and author of essays around spatial media for several books. He won Creator of the Year at the 2022 Poly Awards, was named one of the Top 100 Original Voices in XR in 2021, and contributed to the 2022 PEW Research report on the Metaverse in 2040.

excerpt.rendered:
Keram is the founder and executive director of the VRTO International Symposium on Immersive Media and the FIVARS Festival of Virtual & Augmented Reality Stories. Both ran in WebXR in 2020.

He most recently contributed essays to two books published in 2020: Dyscorpia: Future Intersections of the Body and Technology, Edited by Marilene Oliver and Daniel Laforest, Published by Dept of Art and Design, University of Alberta and Handbook of Research on the Global Impacts and Roles of Immersive Media (editors: Jacquelyn Ford Morie (All These Worlds, LLC, USA) and Kate McCallum (Bridge Arts Media, USA and Vortex Immersion Media, USA).

content.rendered:
Brendan Andolsek Bradley is a multi-award winning actor, writer, director and producer known internationally as “America’s Scrappy Storyteller” (AR Post) with 100+ IMDb credits, 50M+ views online and a leader in the virtual theater movement performing using groundbreaking XR/VR tools.

Brendan established The Integrative Technology Lab at New York University’s Tisch School of the Arts to foster the next generation of multi-disciplinary live storytellers and during the pandemic, he began releasing free tutorials and case-studies for adopting ubiquitous streaming tools for live performance, including a customizable virtual theater in your web browser that allows anyone in the world to get back “on” stage for free. More at brendanAbradley.com/futurestages

Brian Peiris has been sitting at the intersection of XR and the Web since 2013. An early backer of the original Oculus Rift kickstarter, he started experimenting with practical applications of VR, using his skils as a fullstack developer to build a JavaScript VR live-coding app that went viral. This lead to a job at AltspaceVR, a startup at the time, where he established their web-based SDK and developer community.

Brian now works at Mozilla as part of the Mozilla Hubs team, who have been building their virtual social platform since 2017.

content.rendered:
Blair MacIntyre is a Professor of Interactive Computing at Georgia Tech, where he has explored socio-technical issues surrounding AR and VR for more than 20 years. He has built authoring toolkits for media designers, deployed room-scale and handheld games and experiences, built AR-enabled web-browsers, helped lead the design of WebXR, and run online conferences using immersive social VR.

His experience spans all aspects of building, deploying, and evaluating AR and VR tools, systems, and experiences. He has been doing research in augmented reality since 1991, is actively involved with numerous conferences and workshops, speaks and consults regularly, and has published over 100 academic papers in the field.

content.rendered:
Ricardo (@mrdoob) is a self-taught computer-graphics programmer. Originally from Barcelona, he began his professional career alternating between roles as a designer and developer. In his spare time, his involvement in the demoscene set him on the path to learning graphics programming.

Combining his background as a designer and expertise in development, his work ranges from simple interactive digital toys — Google Gravity, Ball Pool and Harmony — to full featured experiences — The Johnny Cash Project, The Wilderness Downtown and ROME.

Nowadays, Ricardo spends most of his time developing open source libraries and tools — three.js, frame.js and stats.js — with the aim of making design and development simpler for everyone.

Kai Frazier is an educator turned EdTech entrepreneur passionate about using tech to provide opportunities for underestimated communities.

She is the founder & CEO of Kai XR, which uses Metaverse technologies to develop critical 21st century skills in students preparing them for a rapidly evolving future. Kai also serves as Global Child Safety & Education Adviser for the XR Safety Initiative, XRSI.

Before creating Kai XR, she worked with several museums such as the United States Holocaust Memorial Museum as well as the Smithsonian National Museum of African American History & Culture, specializing in digital strategy and content creation.
Her company is backed by Techstars & T-Mobile and has been featured in Forbes, NBC, the Steve Harvey Show & more.

content.rendered:
Sophia Moshasha is on a mission to accelerate the adoption of immersive & emerging technologies. Behind the scenes, on camera, and on stage, Sophia is a driving force behind numerous initiatives designed to advance knowledge and engagement with XR across all sectors.

As a producer of The Polys – WebXR Awards and host of its Virtual Red Carpet, Special Correspondent of the WebXR Summit Series and co-host of the VRARA podcast, Sophia has interviewed dozens of XR pioneers and innovators. As a fellow of MetaTr@versal, an initiative to advocate for cooperation among the stakeholders of the Metaverse on standards and interoperability, Sophia was the star of a 40 minute, 3-act play which was performed live on the Main Stage at AWE 2022, which featured a cast of industry heavyweights. She is a co-founder of XR Women, a global collective dedicated to the advancement of female representation in technology.  Sophia will host the WebXR Brand Summit on September 15.

Since 2018, Sophia has been the Vice President of the DC Chapter of the VR/AR Association’s Washington, D.C. Chapter. Sophia is also the co-founder and Chief Marketing Officer for Ready Player Golf, the first annual Virtual Reality Charity Golf Outing, which began in 2020, and has raised money for MSF (Doctors Without Borders) and XRSI (the XR Safety Initiative). She has served as Head of Partnerships for Brightline Interactive, XR Strategist for Virtual Reality Marketing, and in Executive Program support for AFWERX, the US Air Force’s Innovation Investment Program. 


Sophia has been influencing global networks through many years of active engagement in the XR community. She has been featured on prominent media outlets such as Forbes, ABC, CGTN, American Dream TV series and more She holds a Bachelor of Science from Virginia Commonwealth University. She is currently engaged in public policy planning for Meta.

After a combined 20 years of studying and teaching foreign languages, Michael McDonald created Gold Lotus which aims to demonstrate how virtual reality can support the learning and teaching of foreign languages.

Recent projects include the launch of the Handy English VR vocabulary-building app, a 24-hour VR English lesson and cultural event to raise funds for the fight against Covid and programs in schools around the world aimed at raising awareness of how VR can be used to develop language skills and cultural awareness, with particular focus on students building their own webXR spaces to share their local cultural heritage in a unique VR exchange program. His most recent course in partnership with VictoryXR has just concluded on the ENGAGE VR platform – Public Speaking in a Multicultural World.

Since May 2014, Kent Bye has conducted over 1600 Voices of VR podcast interviews featuring the pioneering artists, storytellers, and technologists driving the resurgence of virtual & augmented reality. He’s an oral historian, experiential journalist, & aspiring philosopher, helping to define the patterns of immersive storytelling, experiential design, ethical frameworks, & the ultimate potential of XR.

He’s also been an executive committee member on the IEEE’s Global Initiative on the Ethics of Extended Reality, which has been looking at mapping out the landscape of ethics for virtual and augmented reality. You can hear his latest thoughts on Twitter @kentbye.

The company’s purpose is to help humanity transcend physical location so that everyone can more easily connect, communicate, and collaborate as if they were in person regardless of where they are. Before co-founding Pluto VR he was a creative innovations leader at Deloitte Digital, working with the largest brands in the world to help them stay competitive in the new digital landscape.

He has a diverse background including VR, film, marketing, and crowdfunding. Other projects Include: An automated brewing machine kickstarter that makes beer at the press of a button, a new way to train employees through mobile gaming, and the web series Know Your Meme.

content.rendered:
Daniel Dyboski-Bryant is a humanitarian committed to XR for good. His personal mission is to explore, drive and share the development and application of benevolent and meaningful and impactful experiences with emerging technologies. 

Daniel is the Executive Director of the Virtual World Society – a US non-profit – leading their mission to inspire and enable people to thrive, solve problems and create positive impact with emerging technologies. Since 2015, the VWS has run projects around the globe with families, schools and communities; has recognised and celebrated achievements in the XR community; and has contributed thought leadership to the industry.

Daniel co-founded Educators in VR in 2018 to bring together a global community of 3500 educators pioneering the integration of VR for learning, teaching and beyond. He specializes in R.I.S.E. – Remote Immersive Synchronous Experiences and Education. Educators in VR has run more than 3000 virtual events, workshops, presentations and conferences. In Feb 2020, two weeks before Covid 19 arrived, Educators in VR hosted the 2020 International Educators in VR Summit – a 6-day, 24/7, fully immersive VR conference on 5 platforms with 170 speakers, 150 events and 95% CO2 saving compared with a real-world conference. In May 2021 they ran a similar 30-day conference on 20 immersive VR platforms. Daniel will host the WebXR Production Summit on October 13.

Daniel has been an educator for 25 years, teaching languages, entrepreneurship and innovation and training trainers at colleges, universities and corporations in Germany, England, Wales and online. At Coleg Menai Daniel built and led an immersive learning Lab where he used VR to engage with migrant workers and refugees for which he won Inspire Tutor of the Year award in 2020.

excerpt.rendered:
Daniel is the host of the WebXR Production Summit and

Co-Founder of Educators in VR

meta.talk_description:
Co-founders of Educators in VR Lorelle VanFossen and Daniel Dyboski-Bryant share their extensive experience bringing people together in VR to explore and experience XR immersive education. They\'ve produced over 3,000 educational VR events, workshops, classes, and conferences, bringing a unique perceptive to the potential of XR education and VR events. 

Educators in VR was founded by Lorelle VanFossen and Daniel Dyboski-Bryant in 2018 with the mission to integrate XR immersive technology into education, training, research, and business. The company has grown to over 3,000 global members and supports over 25 special interest groups they call teams, exploring XR industry verticals and niches. Over 60,000 participants have attended their thousands of free and paid events across multiple social VR platforms.

Christina Kinne aka XaosPrincess graduated from Munich Filmschool in 2006.She has worked as director, first a.d., producer, editor, set designer, photographer and journalist, and has directed more than ten movies, including one of Europe’s first live-action 3D-films – “Delusion 3D” (2008).

After her parental leave Christina Kinne found a new creative home in Virtual Reality. Using software like Gravity Sketch or Tilt Brush she designs 3D models for VR in VR.Christina Kinne has produced and hosted a variety of Virtual Reality events.As evangelist she also likes to promote VR in real life – be it by screening live VR content to a RL audience or by producing educational videos.

In July 2020 Christina Kinne joined Tivoli Cloud VR as CMO and Events Manager to help making the dream of a friendly, creative and inclusive metaverse come true.Currently she is also pursuing a second MA in “Digital Narratives” at the International Filmschool Cologne.

content.rendered:
Samantha Mathews is Founder & CEO; CTO of LOCI, a patented and neurologically proven safety training platform that transforms unstructured location and occupancy data into digital components that power a game engine that generates gamified content based on your environment. LOCI teaches people where to go and what to do to stay safe in places they visit and spend time regardless of age, language, or ability.

To Samantha, technology has always been a tool for connecting with people and improving lives. She builds by her belief that, instead of deepening our dependence on technology and letting it do the thinking for us, new systems should empower us to be more present, knowledgeable, and confident wherever we go.

content.rendered:
Dr. Karen Alexander is a sought-after consultant on building immersive learning programs with extensive connections across the XR industry and academia. Her experience spans partnering with community organizations on giving children and youth the opportunity to create with XR tools, guiding higher ed institutions through the process of XR adoption, advising ed tech and XR startups, and, in her role as an immersive learning consultant with MetaVRse, pioneering the translation of of 2D training into 3D experiences for enterprise. 

Dr. Alexander is a co-founder of XR Women, a worldwide network of professionals that meet weekly in virtual worlds and where a distinguished list of XR industry speakers has appeared. As part of the team that produces The Polys – WebXR Awards, WebXR Summit Series, and MetaTr@versal, she has worked with some of the most influential thought leaders in spatial computing. Bringing her passion for metaverse literacy back to her academic roots, Dr. Alexander is host of the WebXR Education Summit, assembling a diverse array of practitioners to share knowledge on successful implementation of immersive learning. She is also a member of the Immersive Learning Research Network’s State of XR and Immersive Learning Expert Panel. 

Prior to her work in XR, Dr. Alexander was Dean of Junior and Senior Year programs at the women’s college at Rutgers University and Senior Editor of Signs: Journal of Women and Culture in Society. Her experience in higher education ranges across teaching, program design, journal editing, and college administration, with specializations in art, literature, film, and cultural production. Dr. Alexander is committed to women’s advancement and gender and racial equality and believes in a Humanity First approach to XR and the metaverse. She holds master’s degrees in English, Philosophy, and Issues in Modern Culture and earned her PhD. at the University of London.

Hugh Hou is a Co-Founder and Creative Director for CreatorUp, a digital media education company and production studio. He heads up immersive media content creation and has produced VR content for numerous companies and organizations such as Samsung, the Special Olympics, Google, Oculus, MasterCard, Twitter, TikTok, RedBull Music, LACOSTE, Huawei, and the Los Angeles Police Department.
He also directs and produces Mixed Reality music videos. He worked with musical artists such as I Prevail, Joyner Lucas, Kristina Sky, Roger Shah, Cypress Hill, and SHAED.

When not producing original VR videos & films, Hugh dedicates his time to sharing his vast expertise in immersive technologies and VR filmmaking on the CreatorUp YouTube channel. He truly believes that by sharing freely with the world through YouTube, mentoring and consulting, more creators will join the immersive media family.
Hugh’s goal is to help the VR industry thrive and to improve the quality of VR filmmaking.

Joanna Popper is an award-winning Hollywood and Silicon Valley media executive with a track record of launching cutting edge content and technology to drive revenue, audience engagement and brand love.

She currently leads HP’s Virtual Reality initiatives for Go-To-Market and Location Based Entertainment. Prior she was EVP of Media & Marketing at Singularity University and VP Marketing at NBCUniversal.

Joanna is Executive Producer on “Breonna’s Garden” which premiered at the Tribeca Festival. This augmented reality experience was created by Lady PhoEnix and Sutu with Ju’Niyah Palmer to honor the life of her sister, Breonna Taylor.

Joanna was Executive Producer on Double Eye Studios’ “Finding Pandora X,” winner of Venice Film Festival Golden Lion for Best VR Experience and the SXSW Audience Award for Virtual Cinema Spotlight. Finding Pandora X is a modern day take on Greek mythology live interactive experience in VRChat.

Joanna was selected as “50 Women Can Change the World in Media and Entertainment,” “Top 50 Original Thinkers in VR,” “Top Women in Media: Game Changers,” “Top Women in Media: Industry Leaders,” “Digital It List,” “101 Women Leading the VR Industry” and is on the Coalition for the Women in XR Fund.

Christina is the CEO of Metastage. Since its founding in 2018, Metastage has completed over 150 productions with major brands and award winning projects, including two Emmy nominations. Metastage is the first North American partner for the Microsoft Mixed Reality Capture technology.

Prior to leading Metastage, Christina was the CEO of VR Playhouse, an immersive content company with immersive projects featured at SXSW, Sundance, and Festival de Cannes. She is a recipient of the Advanced Imaging Society\’s Distinguished Leadership in Technology Award and was named in the Huffington Post as one of 5 women changing the virtual reality scene.

Her writing and research on volumetric video has been published in the textbook, Handbook of Research on the Global Impacts and Roles of Immersive Media (2019), and What is Augmented Reality? Everything You Wanted to Know Featuring Exclusive Interviews with Leaders of the AR Industry (2019).

Dr. June Wang currently serves as Senior Vice President at Futurewei Technologies. She has 20 years of experience in companies such as Qualcomm, Ericsson, Huawei, etc., with expertise in product management, strategy, marketing, and business development in wireless terminals and the mobile ecosystem.

She was also a pivotal leader in account management interfacing with large U.S operators such as Verizon Wireless. In 2015, Dr. Wang helped drive breakthroughs like partnering with Google on the Nexus 6P and Android Wear flagship device. In 2016 she led a team to build a joint lab with Microsoft to support her company’s PC product line. In 2017-2018 her team gained Google VR/AR/Lens Product Area certification and supported partners’ efforts on the first rollout of Android Go and Android Messaging (RCS). In recent years, Dr. Wang’s department focusing on managing master agreements/contracts that are fully compliant with local regulations with top partners in the ecosystem. She believes in the power of open source and fully supports the WebXR efforts in the community.

Christi Fenison is an immersive storyteller, 3D artist, 360 videographer and simulation designer.
Her passion is creating XR experiences that expand perspectives and inspire action. Drawing on principles of narrative transport, cognitive elaboration and the sense of presence, she works to bring big picture ideas to life via the careful interplay of meaningful details.

By day, Christi works as an XR Instructional Media Producer at UNC School of Medicine IT, focused on the research, development and integration of XR training simulations in curriculum. Beyond the classroom, she is also a bespoke World Builder for Social VR events, crafting custom experiences tailored to each client’s vision and goals.

Christi received her Master’s degree from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill’s Environment and Science Communication program, where focused on Emerging Technologies, 3D Modeling + Unity Development, Green Architecture + Sustainable Design, Geospatial Information Systems, and Immersive Journalism.

Caitlin Krause focuses on the intersection of technology, innovation and wellbeing, and founded the studio and consultancy MindWise in 2015. She teaches about the subject at Stanford University. Caitlin has advised global organizations including Google, Facebook, Oracle, TED, Evernote, University of San Francisco, ETH Zürich and the U.S. State Department. In September of 2020 she released the book Designing Wonder: Leading Transformative Experiences in Virtual Reality. She authored The Importance of Presence and The Art of Storytelling in VR as part of the XR Collaboration Global Resource Guide.

Caitlin has created and run numerous collaborative experiences in social XR, fusing presence, mindfulness, storytelling, curiosity and emotional intelligence. A Senior Strategist for the Virtual World Society, she is a writer and designer for digital therapeutic applications that incorporate haptics and biofeedback. After two decades of teaching and leadership experience, she authored Mindful By Design (Corwin Press, 2019). Caitlin helps individuals and teams navigate complexity and change, prioritizing mindful wellbeing, joy, creativity, wonder and awe.

What business problems does WebXR solve today?

Jamie is the CEO and founder of Outlier Ventures. He was an early investor in Bitcoin and Ethereum and founded Outlier Ventures, the Web 3.0 startup accelerator, in 2014. He is an active collector of NFTs and a passionate proponent of the Open Metaverse theory (you can read the thesis: https://outlierventures.io/research/the-open-metaverse-os/). The Open Metaverse thesis was created early 2021 after months of development, and acts as a toolkit to design alternatives based on principles of user centricity and sovereignty of identity, data and wealth.

Jamie is an active media commentator and has spoken on stages across the world about the breadth of opportunity Ethereum posses to serve as the foundation for the next generation of the internet. He is an active collector of NFTs, co-founding 100xARt, a community of the Top 200 collectors and has helped launch the world\’s first d-zine, NFTs.WTF, an independent NFT media property owned and controlled by a DAO of 100 industry leaders, creatives and influencers.

meta.profile_title: Director of Research and Education, Reality Lab
meta.talk_title: Designing Accessible Interactions for the Immersive Web
meta.talk_description: Immersive applications as a new medium have evolving design paradigms. Substantial work has been done to define accessibility guidelines for the traditional 2D web, but efforts are still in progress to ensure the immersive web is accessible to all individuals.  In this presentation, we will explore how interactions in immersive applications can be designed to support a variety of input devices and allow more people to fully experience the immersive web.

Alex Howland, Ph.D., is president and co-founder of Virbela, a virtual world platform for remote work, learning, and events. Howland created Virbela in 2012, before it was purchased and made public by eXp World Holdings in 2018.

Virbela’s mission is to help organizations and people thrive in a remote-first future. Alex leads the development of Virbela’s products and services — continuing to expand the platform to accommodate not just business workspaces, but classrooms, event spaces, and recreational areas as well.

Prior to co-founding Virbela, Howland was an instructor in the Psychology Department at University of California, San Diego, where he taught Industrial and Organizational Psychology to undergraduate students. His expertise in organizational psychology gives him a unique perspective on creating virtual work and education spaces. He designed Virbela specifically to create a unique virtual experience where users feel psychologically safe and are more likely to collaborate, brainstorm, and succeed.

Howland has a bachelor of science in psychology from Providence College, and his Ph.D. in organizational psychology from Alliant International University, San Diego.

Dr. Yu Yuan (Candidate for 2022 IEEE Standards Association President-Elect) is a visionary researcher, inventor, practitioner, and entrepreneur in the areas of Consumer Technology, Multimedia/VR/AR, Connected/Automated Vehicles, IoT, and Digital Transformation. He founded 0xSenses Corporation, a multinational technology company specializing in Virtual Reality.

Dedicated to \”Creating Better Worlds\” as its long-term vision, the company is developing technologies, infrastructures, ecosystems, and resources needed for massively multiplayer ultra-realistic virtual experiences. Prior to this he worked for IBM Research as a research scientist and was a key contributor to IBM\’s Cell Broadband Engine, Smarter Planet, and IoT initiative. He has been a passionate volunteer in various leadership positions at IEEE and other professional communities. His outstanding service in IEEE standards activities at different levels (working groups, standards committees, and governance at higher levels) has been widely appreciated by standards developers, individual members, and corporate members.

He has a Ph.D., an M.S., and a B.S. in Computer Science from Tsinghua University.

Tony Parisi is a Metaverse and virtual reality pioneer, inventor, entrepreneur, investor, author and musician. He has co-created several international 3D graphics standards, including VRML, X3D, and glTF. Tony is the author of O’Reilly Media’s foundational books on 3D graphics and VR, Learning Virtual Reality (2015), Programming 3D Applications in HTML5 and WebGL (2014), and WebGL Up and Running (2012).

One of the leading spokespeople for the immersive industry, Tony has given speeches in multiple countries about industry trends and innovation in augmented reality. He was named in Next Reality’s 30 People to Watch in Augmented Reality in 2020.

Tony is currently serving as Chief Strategy Officer at Lamina1, a new layer 1 blockchain for the Metaverse. He is also an advisor and limited partner in early stage venture firms including ME Ventures, a future-focused investment fund providing opportunities for creators to grow and succeed. Previously, Tony was Head of XR Ads and E-Commerce at Unity, where he oversaw strategy and product for the company’s real-time 3D brand advertising and commerce solutions.

Tony is also a composer and musician. He is currently finishing the cast recording for Judgment Day, a full-length original musical, and has several other music projects underway.

Eren Aksu is an AR/VR Subject Matter Expert and Senior Manager at Deloitte Digital. He brings together technical product management, sales and business development, marketing, strategy and production management experiences focused on the xR industry. His previous projects include dozens of virtual reality, augmented reality and mixed reality launches and releases in collaboration with companies like Google, Facebook, WSJ, SoCal Edison, Chevron and other global brands.

Mr. Aksu has been in the xR space since 2011 and joined Deloitte in 2018 after his role at Emblematic as the 2nd full time employee helping the startup scale exponentially. He helped bootstrap Emblematic with its founders at the Interactive Media Research Lab at USC and was selected as 1 of 10 “VR for Good” film makers by Facebook/Oculus for Facebook’s inaugural “VR for Good” program. The resulting xR film became part of the official selection for SXSW (South by South West) and several other film festivals around the world. After joining Deloitte in 2018, he was selected by Deloitte\’s CIO to lead the Deloitte Digital Reality (DxR) incubation and innovation hub reporting directly to the Deloitte CIO and CTO, and he now serves the US Navy as the AR Lead for their 5G Navy Smart Warehouse project in San Diego.

Mr. Aksu also leads multiple innovation related efforts at Deloitte, such as helping build out and leading content/frontier tech asset curation for Deloitte’s Houston Innovation Center focused on Energy, Resources, and Industrials. He is a frequent speaker and presenter on xR topics at events and conferences globally and is an Advisor at Deloitte’s Startup Deloitte program focused on fostering startup innovation inside Deloitte. He has an extensive network of startups and companies he collaborates with and is also the Co-Founder of Nextopic, a virtual conference series focused on introducing frontier technologies and their impacts on different higher-level topics to audiences around the world. Some of their recent conferences have included Nextopic: Future of Pandemics and Nextopic: Future of Work, which have featured dozens of speakers and thought leaders such as Salman Khan, Founder & CEO of Khan Academy.

Conceptual artist who creates multilayered installations, performances, and experiences with the express intent of elevating his audience to a sublime state. Challenging the relationship between art and spectator Morris’ work is typically equal parts technical, playful, inventive and rich with depth. From Le Louvre to Lady Gaga from Cirque Du Soleil to the Metropolitan Opera, his work has been praised by NY Times, Wall Street Journal, LA Times, Rolling Stone, NBC, VICE, Wired…. Highlight works include; *[NOWHERE](http://www.urnowhere.com/)*, reimagining online gathering; [*Reflecting the Stars*](http://thewindmillfactory.com/?portfolio=reflecting-the-stars), recreating the night sky in the Hudson River; [Choreographing Nine Inch Nails](http://thewindmillfactory.com/?portfolio=nine-inch-nails-festival-tour) Festival Tour; [*Pixel Forest*](http://thewindmillfactory.com/?portfolio=pixel-forest), voice-illuminated balloon forest; [*The Wedge*](https://thewindmillfactory.com/portfolio/interactive-art-installation-burning-man-wedge/), a legendary slide/aerial-performance-center at Burning Man.

In addition to founding [The Windmill Factory](http://www.thewindmillfactory.com), Jon has performed and created with Fuerzabruta, Cirque du Soleil, The MET, Theatre de la Jeune Lune, Patrice Chereau, Robert Wilson, Tina Landau, Aszure Barton, Spymonkey, Diavolo Dance Theatre, Ken Roht’s Orphean Circus, Fabulous Monsters and Jay Scheib.  He has been featured in films by Jonathan Dayton and Valari Faris, David Michalek, and Anson Mount and starred in various national commercials and innumerable embarrassing gigs.

He has been a Thomas J. Watson Fellow, Kinnernet-Europe Experience Director, LaMaMa ETC Artist in residence, Watermill Center Fellow, Tennessee Williams Fellow, NCAA Post Graduate Scholar, 6-time All-American Springboard Diver, and holds a B.A. from the University of the South, Sewanee.  Jon has taught master classes at Harvard, NYU, Columbia, Pace, The University of The South, Vanderbilt.

content.rendered:
Jacquelyn Morie is a pioneer in the domains of computer graphics and virtual reality. She is the founder of All These Worlds, LLC, a company that creates and supports Virtual World experiences and research. Her clients have included NASA, the University of Southern California’s Institute for Creative Technologies (USC/ICT), XPRIZE and the Army Medical Command.

Her ongoing research focuses on how immersion can affect and benefit participants, how the use of Avatars changes both our social connections and our deep understanding of our sense of self, and how multisensory elements combine to create a cognitive gestalt that enhances the feelings of Presence in virtual experiences.

Her 2007 PhD thesis – Meaning and Emplacement in Expressive Immersive Virtual Environments – has been downloaded hundreds of times by emerging VR communities, serving as a deep first introduction and guide to the many important aspects of this new medium, from its female-centric history to a design methodology for emotional impact. It was completed under the supervision of Dr Lizbeth Goodman at the SMARTlab Digital Media Institute University College Dublin, Ireland.

Dr Morie is a long time educator, having created digital programs at the University of Central Florida, the Ringling College of Art and Design, and Otis College of Art and Design. She is the original developer of the first computer animation training program for Walt Disney Feature Animation in the 1990s, as well as similar training programs for companies in the Digital Effects industries, such as Rhythm and Hues Studios. She is a former member of the DARPA ISAT Group, tasked with investigating new topics for DARPA research, and a founder of the USC/ICT, where she served as Senior Scientist for 14 years. She is a three decades member of ACM SIGGRAPH and has served that organization in many capacities over the years.

meta.talk_title: Passion and Purpose: The Deep Wellsprings of XR Inspiration
meta.talk_description: Where do the ideas for outstanding XR projects come from? What motivations and individual histories are at play to spark these projects? And what reasons do creators have for choosing immersive technologies to express their vision? A few examples will start to answer these questions, and maybe inspire you to look deep for your own creative passions.

content.rendered:
I’m a multidisciplinary POC artist from Kentucky. I’m a VR enthusiast and a life long creative. When I was a kid I used to make houses out of paper, when I was a teen I played a copious amount of The Sims, when I went to college I started my art business doing professional photography, graphic design, web design, painting and illustration.

It wasn’t until 2020 that I discovered a love for digital 3D modeling. Exploring social apps on the Oculus Quest during the pandemic, I was immediately drawn to building worlds for people to socialize in.
In the past 12 months I have created and shared over 150 originally crafted VR templates and there are over 2,100 worlds that have my signature on them.

I design all of my environments, structures and furnishings from scratch, having no previous experience in 3D or VR before the joining Altspace. I am the first world builder to successfully monetize templates via Patreon memberships, with over 200 Patrons since November of 2020. I’ve paved the way for other artists in the space to get paid and I teach dozens of aspiring world builders daily and free of charge. Having hosted over 50 events in Altspace, I’ve also introduced countless users to the platform.

I have worked with several notable organizations within VR, such as Naughty by Nature, Public Enemy, The Harlem Film House, BRCvr, DreamlandXR and NFT Oasis and many of my colleagues have as well.

Chris worked 20 years in behavioral health administration and programming before experiencing social presence via VR in 2013. VR changed his professional trajectory when he recognized the disruptive implications remote, immersive, shared experiences, unbound from the physical restraints and proximity requirements of the real world, will have on the way humans work, learn, and socialize.

Listed by Onalytica as a Top 100 influencer in both AR and VR, Chris is particularly noted for keeping a close pulse on the social, educational, artistic and entertainment spaces of the XR movement.

Chris has held a variety of roles including Social VR Liaison for the leading Virtual Reality tech blog ‘Road to VR’, co-founder of Utah VR and Silicon Slopes (AR/VR chapter), Edge of Discovery Ambassador, Siggraph judge, XR consultant/speaker, and Director of AR/VR at Morph 3D where he co-developed portable and persistent avatar systems.

Chris is currently serving as Senior Sales Engineer for ENGAGE XR, delivering virtual collaboration, communication, training, education, events and creative solutions to a growing global market transitioning to the metaverse

content.rendered:
Alex spent 10 years in the games industry with Codemasters before starting RiVR in 2015.

We started making 360 videos for car manufacturers and holiday brands all around the world which led us to create some software to synchronise all the virtual reality headset together. RiVR link is the software that came out of those projects and is now being used all over the world for training in all industries particularly first responders.

RiVR has also created photo realistic fire and crime scene investigation scenarios (RiVR investigate) for UK and US governments and we now see the software being used in multiple sectors.

as we look to the future we are growing our scanning techniques and pipelines allowing us to create two-dimensional documentary series which incorporates 6° of freedom photorealistic room scale virtual reality as well!

Step inside is the new platform we are creating to allow people to go that next step with a documentary film or TV series.

problems surrounding how we interact and engage with each other in physical and virtual worlds. He is

MGM, Intel, Microsoft, SyFy, Dreamworks, and MTV through those ventures.

He is now launching a new form of virtual reality, called hyper reality, in the form of the multi-sensory
entertainment company JUMP. JUMP will allow people to come as close to jumping and flying as the
real thing, but without all of the risk.

content.rendered:
Space Popular is directed by Lara Lesmes and Fredrik Hellberg, both alumni of the Architectural Association in London (2011). They founded the practice in Bangkok (2013) and have been based in London since 2016. Space Popular creates spaces, objects, and events in both physical and virtual space, concentrating on how the two realms can blend together.

The studio has completed buildings, exhibitions, public artworks, furniture collections, and interiors across Asia and Europe, as well as virtual architecture for the immersive internet. Clients, collaborators, and commissioners include national institutions such as MAXXI – National Museum of 21st Century Art, Rome, Italy; The Swedish Centre for Architecture and Design –ArkDes, Stockholm, Sweden; Royal Institute of British Architects, London, UK; National Museum of Modern and Contemporary Art, Seoul, South Korea; as well as independent galleries such as MAGAZIN, Vienna, Austria; and Sto Werkstatt, London, UK.

Lesmes and Hellberg both have extensive academic experience having taught architectural design studio since 2011, first at INDA, Chulalongkorn University in Bangkok, since 2016 at the Architectural Association in London, and since 2020 at Daniels, Faculty of Architecture, University of Toronto. Their current MArch design and research studio at Daniels investigates visions for civic architecture in the immersive internet.

content.rendered:
Avi Bar-Zeev has been at the forefront of XR and The Metaverse for over 30 years: first launching Disney’s groundbreaking Aladdin VR ride in the early 90s, crafting Second Life’s 3D worlds and co-founding Keyhole (Google Earth) mirror-earth 3D browser around 2001. He co-invented Microsoft Hololens in 2010, helped defined Amazon Echo Frames in 2015, and then contributed at Apple on undisclosed projects.

Since leaving Apple, he’s consulted privately for top XR companies and investors. And he’s taken a more public stance by writing and speaking publicly on important issues like privacy, biometric sensing and mental autonomy, targeted and future experiential advertising, DEI and harassment in XR, and various open Metaverse/web3 architectures.

Most recently, he is a founder and President of The XR Guild, a new non-profit membership organization that seeks to support and educate professionals in XR on ethics and most positive outcomes for humanity.

Trent is on a mission to pioneer immersive technology and transform human experience for good.

To achieve this, Trent believes in the power of storytelling and immersive technology to drive a new paradigm of change and climate action. Through emerging tools like VR, AR MR and WebXR, we can raise awareness for social and environmental impact causes like never before.

As the Co-founder and CEO at PHORIA, a Melbourne-based XR Studio, Trent and his team have been Emmy nominated for their previous work in WebXR with Meta and the International Paralympics Committee. Alongside working closely with respected partners and world leaders including Netflix, Google, WWF and the United Nations (UN).

content.rendered: Haggai Goldfarb, has held leadership positions with a distinguished track record of delivering successful large-scale projects and products to market. For over a decade he led VFX teams in Hollywood with significant roles at Warner Bros. Disney, DreamQuest and DreamWorks. Notable awards include: The recent prestigious Polys WebXR Awards 2021 with 3 wins for Experience of the year, Education experience of the year, and Video experience of the year for ‘The Magic of Flight’ XR experience, AIXR VR Awards 2021 nomination, DreamWorks Achievement Award, Kung-Fu Panda’s 2008 Academy Award Nomination for Best Animated Feature of the year, as well as winning the 36th Annual Annie Awards in 10 categories, including Best Animated Feature, ‘The High Ground Award’ strategy war games, between M.I.T Sloan Fellows and Harvard Business School, and has served as judge for the Animation Oscars. A visionary, inventor and a Metaverse pioneer, Haggai pursuit of the Metaverse and related Extended Reality (XR) and Enhanced Reality (ER) technologies (e.g 3D,VFX, AR,VR, MR) span over 20 years. At DreamWorks he managed key innovation, development and integration of the Academy award-winning “Shrek” facial system, adapting it to DreamWorks’ animated features franchise pipeline. By enabling animators to convey emotions through facial expressions as never before, the Shrek facial system, was the breakthrough that allowed Shrek to be the first computer- animated film ever to put digital human characters in leading roles, leading it to become the highest- grossing animated franchise of all times, with over $3.5B in revenues. In 2006, Haggai launched a tech startup out of M.I.T focused on the innovation of the next generation natural human interface for the Metaverse. His innovation lab created key technologies and XR experiences that preceded commercial VR headsets including avatar interaction, head, facial and eye tracking, gestural and haptic. At Microsoft Haggai led Mixed Reality (MR) initiatives and R&D prototyping on HoloLens including the first shareable HoloLens Mixed Reality experience development at Microsoft which preceded “Mesh”. Most recently Haggai led XR strategy at Meta driving global XR initiatives, partnerships and teams in NA, APAC and EMEA. Notably, he produced and oversaw the creation and deployment for the first WebXR/OpenXR project, Project Origami: “The Magic of Flight”. As an innovation leader, he operates at the intersection of business, technology and creative. Haggai is an Alfred Sloan Fellow receiving his MBA from the MIT Sloan School of Management.

John Collins a.k.a. The Paper Airplane Guy held the world record holder for paper airplane distance for ten years. Author of five books of original designs, John has been called the world’s foremost expert on paper aircraft. He has appeared on Conan, Nat Geo, Discovery, Science Channel, ESPN’s Sports Science, Ripley’s Believe It or Not, as well as performing live for TedX Munich, Google Zeitgeist, WIRED 21, Harvard’s Graduate School of Design, and more than 90 in-person presentations per year.

If you’ve never seen a paper airplane flaps it’s wings, flip over and fly back upside down, spin, circle, loop or stay aloft for minutes indoors; tighten your seat belt and stow your tray table. You’re cleared for takeoff!

content.rendered: Athena Demos is co-founder and CEO of Big Rock Creative (BRC), an award-winning XR experience company creating groundbreaking experiences for global clients. Big Rock Creative won the Producer’s Guild Award for Innovation, the Aurea Award for creativity, the No Proscenium award for Best VR experience of 2020, the Hermes’ Platinum Award, and the Auggie Award for Best Societal Impact of 2022. With over 20 years of experience producing iconic events, like the LA Burning Man Decompression Arts and Music Celebration, as well as the Art of Change Inaugural Ball for President Obama in LA, she transitioned to the metaverse to produce BRCvr (Black Rock City Virtual Reality). BRCvr is an official virtual Burning Man Experience whose scope is unprecedented in the VR space. Athena produced internationally recognized social impact projects such as Breonna’s Garden which premiered at SXSW 2022. She has developed a philosophical approach to guiding humanity to build a foundational fabric for creative collaboration in the metaverse. As a result, she has been quoted in leading books, articles and spoken at leading industry events.

and internationally. Some other feature-length docs include “Faire: An
