title.rendered: Welcome to the WebXR Education Summit

content.rendered: Summits creator Ben Erwin welcomes the audience, looks ahead to the great lineup of speakers on immersive education, and introduces host Dr. Karen Alexander.

excerpt.rendered: Summits creator Ben Erwin welcomes the audience, looks ahead to the great lineup of speakers on immersive education, and introduces host Dr. Karen Alexander.

content.rendered: Dr. Karen Alexander sets the context and scope of presentations on Immersive Education and addresses the role of WebXR as an enabler for accelerated development of accessible XR programs.

excerpt.rendered: Dr. Karen Alexander sets the context and scope of presentations on Immersive Education and addresses the role of WebXR as an enabler for accelerated development of accessible XR programs.

title.rendered: Safety, Privacy, and Ethical Design in XR for Education

content.rendered: XR technologies are powerful tools with enormous potential to transform education. Yet these technologies also come with considerable risks. This panel will explore delve into philosophical and ethical issues surrounding the use of XR with young people and will address ways to ensure safety, privacy, and human dignity.

excerpt.rendered: XR technologies are powerful tools with enormous potential to transform education. Yet these technologies also come with considerable risks. This panel will explore delve into philosophical and ethical issues surrounding the use of XR with young people and will address ways to ensure safety, privacy, and human dignity.

content.rendered: In this practice-focused panel, leading XR educators discuss the most effective tools available for use in the classroom and how teachers can employ them in lessons.

excerpt.rendered: In this practice-focused panel, leading XR educators discuss the most effective tools available for use in the classroom and how teachers can employ them in lessons.

content.rendered: Co-founders of Educators in VR Lorelle von Fossen and Daniel Dyboski-Bryant have extensive experience bringing people together in VR to share their knowledge and experience of  XR education. Here they will discuss what they have gleaned from the hundreds of events they’ve produced.

excerpt.rendered: Co-founders of Educators in VR Lorelle von Fossen and Daniel Dyboski-Bryant have extensive experience bringing people together in VR to share their knowledge and experience of  XR education. Here they will discuss what they have gleaned from the hundreds of events they’ve produced.

title.rendered: Gamification and Instructional Design for Immersive Learning

content.rendered: Design is key for all learning, and immersive learning is no exception. And gamification represents one strategy that can provide structure and enhance engagement in learning. This session explores immersive learning design strategies and why they matter.

excerpt.rendered: Design is key for all learning, and immersive learning is no exception. And gamification represents one strategy that can provide structure and enhance engagement in learning. This session explores immersive learning design strategies and why they matter.

content.rendered: Summit co-host Julie Smithson synthesizes the key takeaways from the WebXR Education Summit, making sense out of what we learned, and talks about building digital mindsets in organizations. That starts with how people need to continuously adapt to the evolving needs of their jobs in order to seize new opportunities.

excerpt.rendered: Summit co-host Julie Smithson synthesizes the key takeaways from the WebXR Education Summit, making sense out of what we learned, and talks about building digital mindsets in organizations. That starts with how people need to continuously adapt to the evolving needs of their jobs in order to seize new opportunities.

content.rendered: The African continent is rich in opportunities to build new educational models from the ground up and to prepare its young and growing population for a future in which XR is a primary computing platform. Experts from the continent will talk about their initiatives and key considerations.

excerpt.rendered: The African continent is rich in opportunities to build new educational models from the ground up and to prepare its young and growing population for a future in which XR is a primary computing platform. Experts from the continent will talk about their initiatives and key considerations.

content.rendered: Government funding for education comes with a mandate for accessibility. Failure to account for the needs of the differently abled could potentially expose institutions to lawsuits. Roland Dubois, a leading educator on WebXR and accessibility shares what you need to know to make sure your program serves the needs of everyone, in compliance with governmental regulation.

excerpt.rendered: Government funding for education comes with a mandate for accessibility. Failure to account for the needs of the differently abled could potentially expose institutions to lawsuits. Roland Dubois, a leading educator on WebXR and accessibility shares what you need to know to make sure your program serves the needs of everyone, in compliance with governmental […]

title.rendered: Championing the Arts & Humanities in Tech-Enabled Education

content.rendered: XR education is not all about STEM. In fact, the affordances of XR make it highly effective for teaching arts and humanities. Experienced educators talk about how they have adopted XR to teach these subjects.

excerpt.rendered: XR education is not all about STEM. In fact, the affordances of XR make it highly effective for teaching arts and humanities. Experienced educators talk about how they have adopted XR to teach these subjects.

title.rendered: Assessing Learning for the Age of XR

content.rendered: New learning tools require new means of assessment. And XR permits the collection of data that encompasses much more than was previously possible.

excerpt.rendered: New learning tools require new means of assessment. And XR permits the collection of data that encompasses much more than was previously possible.

content.rendered: As metaversities spring up and XR is increasingly adopted for education, policies, processes, and even organizational structures need to adapt to meet the opportunities and address new challenges. Here we examine actionable steps in constructing successful XR programs.

excerpt.rendered: As metaversities spring up and XR is increasingly adopted for education, policies, processes, and even organizational structures need to adapt to meet the opportunities and address new challenges. Here we examine actionable steps in constructing successful XR programs.

title.rendered: Enabling Different Abilities with XR Content

content.rendered: Immersive learning can unlock potential for Special Education and people with different abilities, such as autism or those with mobility and cognitive impairments. The panel of experts explore success stories of how XR empowers those left behind in traditional education.

excerpt.rendered: Immersive learning can unlock potential for Special Education and people with different abilities, such as autism or those with mobility and cognitive impairments. The panel of experts explore success stories of how XR empowers those left behind in traditional education.

content.rendered: International medical equipment manufacturer Siemens Healthineers are remaking their employee education program using WebXR. Sophia meets with Jennifer Crawford to talk about how the scalability of delivering immersive content over the web enables rapid expansion with measurable results.

excerpt.rendered: International medical equipment manufacturer Siemens Healthineers are remaking their employee education program using WebXR. Sophia meets with Jennifer Crawford to talk about how the scalability of delivering immersive content over the web enables rapid expansion with measurable results.

title.rendered: State of Immersive Learning with XR

content.rendered: The Immersive Learning Research Network annually convenes a panel of experts to produce the State of XR and Immersive Learning Report. Leaders of this initiative discuss highlights of the 2022 report in progress.

excerpt.rendered: The Immersive Learning Research Network annually convenes a panel of experts to produce the State of XR and Immersive Learning Report. Leaders of this initiative discuss highlights of the 2022 report in progress.

content.rendered: Dr. Johnson-Glenberg shares insights from her research on learning and retention with XR and how that research informs experiences developed by her award-winning company, Embodied Games, and the rubric she has developed to help determine the pedagogical quality of lessons in virtual reality.

excerpt.rendered: Dr. Johnson-Glenberg shares insights from her research on learning and retention with XR and how that research informs experiences developed by her award-winning company, Embodied Games, and the rubric she has developed to help determine the pedagogical quality of lessons in virtual reality.

content.rendered: The Metaversity project led by Victory XR is a program of 10 Universities building digital twins in the Metaverse; Steve Grubbs shares with us the details of this pioneering initiative in an effort to inspire other schools to expand into immersive education.

excerpt.rendered: The Metaversity project led by Victory XR is a program of 10 Universities building digital twins in the Metaverse; Steve Grubbs shares with us the details of this pioneering initiative in an effort to inspire other schools to expand into immersive education.

title.rendered: Findings on the Effectiveness of XR for Education

content.rendered: The evidence for the effectiveness of XR in learning is more than anecdotal. These researchers represent the cutting edge of those whose work can show us what really works.

excerpt.rendered: The evidence for the effectiveness of XR in learning is more than anecdotal. These researchers represent the cutting edge of those whose work can show us what really works.

content.rendered: We are at the very beginning of an era where spatial content over the web will educate, entertain, and ultimately reach an audience of billions. It’s time to examine what it will take to grow from early proofs of concepts to envision the Immersive Web of the next decade.

excerpt.rendered: We are at the very beginning of an era where spatial content over the web will educate, entertain, and ultimately reach an audience of billions. It’s time to examine what it will take to grow from early proofs of concepts to envision the Immersive Web of the next decade.

title.rendered: Classroom Case Study – The Magic of Flight

content.rendered: The Magic of Flight swept its categories at The Polys – WebXR Awards winning Video Experience, Education Experience, and Experience of the Year trophies . Sophia Moshasha interviews John Collins, who has more than 30 years experience in STEM education, on how immersive makes teaching science a dream come true.

excerpt.rendered: The Magic of Flight swept its categories at The Polys – WebXR Awards winning Video Experience, Education Experience, and Experience of the Year trophies . Sophia Moshasha interviews John Collins, who has more than 30 years experience in STEM education, on how immersive makes teaching science a dream come true.

title.rendered: Teaching in Virtual Campuses and Classrooms

content.rendered: When the rules of time and physics don’t apply, you can teach anywhere at any moment in history and take the students with you. We’ll hear from teachers who are also world builders on what they’ve learned while teaching in VR.

excerpt.rendered: When the rules of time and physics don’t apply, you can teach anywhere at any moment in history and take the students with you. We’ll hear from teachers who are also world builders on what they’ve learned while teaching in VR.

title.rendered: Bringing Immersive Education to Underserved Communities

content.rendered: “The Digital Divide” hasn’t been solved yet to provide equitable access to the internet, let alone immersive education. This panel will explore what it will take to accelerate the equitable delivery of Immersive Education to the underprivileged communities so that teachers and students have the access, exposure, and opportunity to take advantage of the best of today’s tools.

excerpt.rendered: “The Digital Divide” hasn’t been solved yet to provide equitable access to the internet, let alone immersive education. This panel will explore what it will take to accelerate the equitable delivery of Immersive Education to the underprivileged communities so that teachers and students have the access, exposure, and opportunity to take advantage of the best […]

content.rendered: Medical training is one of the most important use cases in XR, because it gives students and healthcare professionals immersive access to realistic healthcare scenarios, without posing risks to live patients, and without requiring the extensive resources needed for re-enactment in a live clinical training setting on a per learner basis. From operating medical machines to understanding patient perspectives, immersive learning programs are more effective and economical than traditional 2D modalities. Hear from leading experts in immersive medical education.

excerpt.rendered: Medical training is one of the most important use cases in XR, because it gives students and healthcare professionals immersive access to realistic healthcare scenarios, without posing risks to live patients, and without requiring the extensive resources needed for re-enactment in a live clinical training setting on a per learner basis. From operating medical machines […]

content.rendered: Host Sophia Moshasha previews the exciting day ahead where we will explore the frontier of immersive marketing, advertising, sales, and commerce.

excerpt.rendered: Host Sophia Moshasha previews the exciting day ahead where we will explore the frontier of immersive marketing, advertising, sales, and commerce.

title.rendered: The Road to Mass Consumer Adoption

content.rendered: Taking this new medium to scale is the key to world-wide adoption and monetization. A discussion with Bob Bjarke from Meta about what it will take to get the immersive industry to a place where this medium will become a part of the daily life of a consumer.

excerpt.rendered: Taking this new medium to scale is the key to world-wide adoption and monetization. A discussion with Bob Bjarke from Meta about what it will take to get the immersive industry to a place where this medium will become a part of the daily life of a consumer.

title.rendered: WebXR Ad Monetization – Zesty Market Place

content.rendered: Adtech is a big part of Monetization for brands and WebXR takes this opportunity to a whole new level.

excerpt.rendered: Adtech is a big part of Monetization for brands and WebXR takes this opportunity to a whole new level.

title.rendered: XR Product Placement and Native Advertising

content.rendered: What does product placement mean in the Metaverse and could it replace digital advertising as a more organic means of connecting with the consumer?

excerpt.rendered: What does product placement mean in the Metaverse and could it replace digital advertising as a more organic means of connecting with the consumer?

content.rendered: The spatial medium gives us new ways to make people think. When you can do anything, what creativity can be unleashed?

excerpt.rendered: The spatial medium gives us new ways to make people think. When you can do anything, what creativity can be unleashed?

content.rendered: It is important to develop a strategy that links the physical to the virtual world, creating creative opportunities to accelerate revenue for physical products. Join this discussion on how to achieve this through seamless, fun, organic, and interactive ways in the metaverse.

excerpt.rendered: It is important to develop a strategy that links the physical to the virtual world, creating creative opportunities to accelerate revenue for physical products. Join this discussion on how to achieve this through seamless, fun, organic, and interactive ways in the metaverse.

title.rendered: Welcome to the WebXR Brand Summit

content.rendered: WebXR Summit Series creator Ben Erwin welcomes host Sophia Moshasha and the audience to our fifth event. This one is built to be a catalyst for accelerating investment in the Immersive Web through educating the marketing and advertising community.

excerpt.rendered: WebXR Summit Series creator Ben Erwin welcomes host Sophia Moshasha and the audience to our fifth event. This one is built to be a catalyst for accelerating investment in the Immersive Web through educating the marketing and advertising community.

content.rendered: The Metaverse doesn’t just open opportunities to create payment rails for existing physical products or services, but it also creates opportunities for alternative revenues streams through selling goods/services exclusively available virtually.

excerpt.rendered: The Metaverse doesn’t just open opportunities to create payment rails for existing physical products or services, but it also creates opportunities for alternative revenues streams through selling goods/services exclusively available virtually.

content.rendered: Beyond the NFT hype cycle lies the practical matter of digital attribution, copyrights and portability of digital goods.

content.rendered: Sophia Moshasha has a conversation with Igalia founders Juan José Sánchez Penas and Sergio Villar Senin to tell the story of how the Wolvic Browser came to be. Mozilla discontinued development of the open-source Firefox® Reality browser in 2020 leaving the community of WebXR developers without a hardware-independent browser. Then Igalia stepped-in, resurrecting and modernizing the code base, and recently released Wolvic! See what opportunities and plans lie ahead for the only Immersive-Only browser in XR.

content.rendered:
Patrick Cozzi was honored on March 5, 2023 on the LED Volume at ZeroSpace in Brooklyn, New York for his work in developing the gtTF Specification. This award was both the first time a Poly was presented in- person, and presented in a Looking Glass Holographic display.

The award was presented by Shawn Frayne, CEO and Co-Founder of Looking Glass, along with a video where prior honoree, Brandon Jones who selected Patrick as his successor honored his work. This was followed by love from the community by Patrick’s friends and colleagues Neil Trevett, Nadine Alameh, Damon Hernandez, and Tony Parisi.

items.title: WebXR Business Summit
items.content:
Thank you for participating in the WebXR Business Summit hosted by Samantha Mathews on September 14, 2021

Stay tuned for the launch of the individual videos, coming soon.

The summit featured WebXR business leaders and pioneers sharing their knowledge of and experience with immersive technologies, which are already producing ROI through work efficiencies, improved performances, and a sustainable global footprint. 

Perspectives include WebXR success stories, lessons learned, persona alignment, communication, and collaboration to ensure successful business outcomes.  

Galaxy Sponsor

We encourage you to join the community by coming to the watch parties hosted on SEVEN different platforms for this event! Thank you to all the people that helped make this possible.

items.title: Samantha Mathews
items.content:
Samantha Mathews is Founder & CEO; CTO of LOCI, a patented and neurologically proven safety training platform that transforms unstructured location and occupancy data into digital components that power a game engine that generates gamified content based on your environment. LOCI teaches people where to go and what to do to stay safe in places they visit and spend time regardless of age, language, or ability.

To Samantha, technology has always been a tool for connecting with people and improving lives. She builds by her belief that, instead of deepening our dependence on technology and letting it do the thinking for us, new systems should empower us to be more present, knowledgeable, and confident wherever we go.

items.title: Samantha Mathews
items.content:
Samantha Mathews is Founder & CEO; CTO of LOCI, a patented and neurologically proven safety training platform that transforms unstructured location and occupancy data into digital components that power a game engine that generates gamified content based on your environment. LOCI teaches people where to go and what to do to stay safe in places they visit and spend time regardless of age, language, or ability.

To Samantha, technology has always been a tool for connecting with people and improving lives. She builds by her belief that, instead of deepening our dependence on technology and letting it do the thinking for us, new systems should empower us to be more present, knowledgeable, and confident wherever we go.

items.title: Alban Denoyel
items.content: Alban Denoyel is the co-founder of Sketchfab, the leading platform to publish and find 3D content online, now part of Epic Games. Prior to Sketchfab, he worked for 4 years in the 2D world of photography. He loves making 3D content with photogrammetry or VR sculpting. He graduated from ESSEC Business School (Paris, France).

items.title: WebXR at the European Parliament and UNICEF Innovation Fund Startups
Fabien Bénétou
items.content: Fabien Bénétou is a WebXR freelance developer currently working for UNICEF and the European Parliament. Based in Brussels, Belgium, Fabien is a Mozilla AFrame contributor driven by the need to make virtual and augmented reality understandable by anybody curious enough to try. He has organized events, given talks and lead dozens of professional workshops all around the world. His focus goes beyond the technology to the positive impact it can offer through privacy conscious methods to bring VR and AR innovations to the most wide possible audience. He is convinced that XR will become useful once used and challenged by the most diverse audience.

items.title: Building Industry Consensus around Standards
items.content: The rising tide lifts all boats when competitors can agree on specifications. We’re advocating for the adoption of the WebXR Specification to become a standard to allow developers to run experiences that are compatible across browser platforms.

items.title: Sophia Moshasha
items.content:
Sophia Moshasha is on a mission to accelerate the adoption of immersive & emerging technologies. Behind the scenes, on camera, and on stage, Sophia is a driving force behind numerous initiatives designed to advance knowledge and engagement with XR across all sectors.

As a producer of The Polys - WebXR Awards and host of its Virtual Red Carpet, Special Correspondent of the WebXR Summit Series and co-host of the VRARA podcast, Sophia has interviewed dozens of XR pioneers and innovators. As a fellow of MetaTr@versal, an initiative to advocate for cooperation among the stakeholders of the Metaverse on standards and interoperability, Sophia was the star of a 40 minute, 3-act play which was performed live on the Main Stage at AWE 2022, which featured a cast of industry heavyweights. She is a co-founder of XR Women, a global collective dedicated to the advancement of female representation in technology.  Sophia will host the WebXR Brand Summit on September 15.

Since 2018, Sophia has been the Vice President of the DC Chapter of the VR/AR Association’s Washington, D.C. Chapter. Sophia is also the co-founder and Chief Marketing Officer for Ready Player Golf, the first annual Virtual Reality Charity Golf Outing, which began in 2020, and has raised money for MSF (Doctors Without Borders) and XRSI (the XR Safety Initiative). She has served as Head of Partnerships for Brightline Interactive, XR Strategist for Virtual Reality Marketing, and in Executive Program support for AFWERX, the US Air Force’s Innovation Investment Program. 


Sophia has been influencing global networks through many years of active engagement in the XR community. She has been featured on prominent media outlets such as Forbes, ABC, CGTN, American Dream TV series and more She holds a Bachelor of Science from Virginia Commonwealth University. She is currently engaged in public policy planning for Meta.

items.title: Yu Yuan
items.content:
Dr. Yu Yuan (Candidate for 2022 IEEE Standards Association President-Elect) is a visionary researcher, inventor, practitioner, and entrepreneur in the areas of Consumer Technology, Multimedia/VR/AR, Connected/Automated Vehicles, IoT, and Digital Transformation. He founded 0xSenses Corporation, a multinational technology company specializing in Virtual Reality.

Dedicated to \"Creating Better Worlds\" as its long-term vision, the company is developing technologies, infrastructures, ecosystems, and resources needed for massively multiplayer ultra-realistic virtual experiences. Prior to this he worked for IBM Research as a research scientist and was a key contributor to IBM\'s Cell Broadband Engine, Smarter Planet, and IoT initiative. He has been a passionate volunteer in various leadership positions at IEEE and other professional communities. His outstanding service in IEEE standards activities at different levels (working groups, standards committees, and governance at higher levels) has been widely appreciated by standards developers, individual members, and corporate members.

He has a Ph.D., an M.S., and a B.S. in Computer Science from Tsinghua University.

items.title: Neil Trevett
items.content: Neil is VP Developer Ecosystems at NVIDIA, where he works to enable applications to take advantage of GPUs. Neil has been the elected President of the Khronos Group for over twenty years, where he initiated the OpenGL ES standard used by billions worldwide, helped catalyze the WebGL, Vulkan and OpenXR APIs for portable 3D and augmented and virtual reality, and the glTF run-time 3D asset format. Most recently Neil initiated and now Chairs the Metaverse Standards Forum with over 1,800 member companies.

items.title: Atsushi Shimono
items.content:
Working as W3C/Keio team staff from 2018, on internationalization (especially on Japanese), immersive-web (WebXR), and Timed-Text. Interested in advanced Web technologies, and organizing Web or open source related communities in Japan from 2005.
PhD (Science/Astrophysics)

items.title: Daniel Ljunggren
items.content: Daniel Ljunggren has 10 years of accomplishments within Product Management and another 10 years within Business Development & Strategic Partnerships gained from global leadership roles within the smartphone, mobile apps & services, IoT, and AR/VR industry.

items.title: Selling the Matrix: Communicating the Business Case
items.content: Morpheus said it best, “You cannot be told what The Matrix is, you have to see it for yourself.”  Onboarding decision-makers to XR and convincing them of the urgency to wrap their head around the business potential of the medium of the 21st Century.

items.title: Alan Smithson
items.content:
My purpose in life is to inspire and educate people to think and act in a socially, economically and environmentally responsible way.
I make creator tools: Emulator , MetaVRse, and Your Director AI (Stealth)
I am a TEDx Speaker, Podcast Host and was  featured on Dragons’ Den. I was a DJ for more than 20 years performing for millions of people winning DJ Mag’s Innovative Product of the Year in 2011.

items.title: Veronica Orvalho
items.content:
Verónica Orvalho is the founder and CEO of Didimo. She has translated years of research, data science, and computer graphics expertise into a patented technology platform to create digital humans, empowering people to engage more authentically and humanly in digital spaces. This breakthrough provides the next evolution of how humans will engage the world around them.

Veronica earned a Ph.D. in Computer Graphics and is a professor at Porto University. She has lived and worked on three continents, with companies like IBM, Sony, Amazon, Universal Studios, and more.

items.title: Terry Proto
items.content: Experienced entrepreneur with a professional background in creative media in the US, Europe and Asia. In 2015, when VR/AR exploded onto the scene, Terry saw the potential in a growing creative market whose professionals would need help with strategic and business development advice. Since then Terry founded his XR Business Consulting agency and the leading VR/AR/Metaverse showcase and community: VirtualRealityMarketing.com

items.title: Jason Lovell
items.content:
Jason Lovell, PwC UK Head of XR Strategy

Jason\'s overriding focus is on helping clients across multiple industries understand, quantify, and implement the benefits of virtual reality and augmented reality technology, with a focus on deriving clear return on investment.

Passionate about articulating the real business value of emerging technologies, Jason has significant experience across consumer electronics & innovation in a variety of senior roles, including managing VR for Samsung UK, founding his own XR consultancy \'Captivate\', and managing EMEA brand partnerships for Jaunt XR.

items.title: Emilios Eracleous
items.content:
Emilios Eracleous is the Specialist XR Recruiter & Co-Founder of Immersive Search, where he provides exceptional XR talent to businesses across the globe. Currently, his main focus is on addressing the skills gap in XR, by building a global network of talent and connecting them to the organizations that need them.

Emilios is a senior recruitment professional, who has a demonstrated track record of successfully delivering recruitment and retention solutions to a diverse client range, including industry leading organisations and start-ups.

items.title: Karen Alexander
items.content:
Dr. Karen Alexander is a sought-after consultant on building immersive learning programs with extensive connections across the XR industry and academia. Her experience spans partnering with community organizations on giving children and youth the opportunity to create with XR tools, guiding higher ed institutions through the process of XR adoption, advising ed tech and XR startups, and, in her role as an immersive learning consultant with MetaVRse, pioneering the translation of of 2D training into 3D experiences for enterprise. 

Dr. Alexander is a co-founder of XR Women, a worldwide network of professionals that meet weekly in virtual worlds and where a distinguished list of XR industry speakers has appeared. As part of the team that produces The Polys - WebXR Awards, WebXR Summit Series, and MetaTr@versal, she has worked with some of the most influential thought leaders in spatial computing. Bringing her passion for metaverse literacy back to her academic roots, Dr. Alexander is host of the WebXR Education Summit, assembling a diverse array of practitioners to share knowledge on successful implementation of immersive learning. She is also a member of the Immersive Learning Research Network’s State of XR and Immersive Learning Expert Panel. 

Prior to her work in XR, Dr. Alexander was Dean of Junior and Senior Year programs at the women’s college at Rutgers University and Senior Editor of Signs: Journal of Women and Culture in Society. Her experience in higher education ranges across teaching, program design, journal editing, and college administration, with specializations in art, literature, film, and cultural production. Dr. Alexander is committed to women’s advancement and gender and racial equality and believes in a Humanity First approach to XR and the metaverse. She holds master’s degrees in English, Philosophy, and Issues in Modern Culture and earned her PhD. at the University of London.

items.title: Christopher Lafayette
items.content:
Christopher Lafayette is an emergent technologist in XR applying his talents to Medtech, FinTech, Climate and applied sciences.

He is working for a more equitable future in technology serving as a Silicon Valley national and international speaker, thought leader and a culture advocate.

items.title: Alex Howland
items.content:
Alex Howland, Ph.D., is president and co-founder of Virbela, a virtual world platform for remote work, learning, and events. Howland created Virbela in 2012, before it was purchased and made public by eXp World Holdings in 2018.

Virbela’s mission is to help organizations and people thrive in a remote-first future. Alex leads the development of Virbela’s products and services -- continuing to expand the platform to accommodate not just business workspaces, but classrooms, event spaces, and recreational areas as well.

Prior to co-founding Virbela, Howland was an instructor in the Psychology Department at University of California, San Diego, where he taught Industrial and Organizational Psychology to undergraduate students. His expertise in organizational psychology gives him a unique perspective on creating virtual work and education spaces. He designed Virbela specifically to create a unique virtual experience where users feel psychologically safe and are more likely to collaborate, brainstorm, and succeed.

Howland has a bachelor of science in psychology from Providence College, and his Ph.D. in organizational psychology from Alliant International University, San Diego.

items.title: Vivian Chan
items.content:
Vivian is the CEO of Red Threads and former Global Head of Digital Sales at NexTech AR Solutions, one Canada's fastest-growing publicly traded technology companies in digital experience and augmented reality. With 20 years of experience creating monetization strategies for emerging technology, she has helped scale three high-growth startups and served on the merger & acquisitions committee at VMware.

Vivian is a lauded Ecosystem builder — she is Globe and Mail’s Top 50 Executive and a YWCA Women of Distinction Nominee in 2021.

items.title: PaaS, SaaS, and Native Browser Support
items.content: These business models for delivering WebXR solutions to customers each have a different cost-benefit analysis. This is an explanation for decision makers on how to navigate the ecosystem by choosing what makes the most sense for them based on their use cases.

items.title: Nisha Burton
items.content:
As the CMO and Co-Founder of Reflective Brands, Nisha has a robust collection of skills pertaining to the media industry, digital marketing, and branding. Nisha specializes in helping companies elevate their brand identity and accomplish their goals through custom immersive experiences using VR/AR, strategic branding, and transmedia marketing. She is also a skilled filmmaker and currently she serves on the executive board of the OMPA the top trade organization for media production professionals in Oregon.

With over 15 years of experience in this field, Nisha brings expertise in utilizing the power of storytelling and cutting-edge technologies to get exceptional marketing results.

items.title: Caspar Thykier
items.content:
Caspar Thykier is the co-founder and CEO of Zappar, an augmented reality platform and creative studio on a mission to democratize immersive technology.

Caspar and the Zappar team have been pioneers in the AR space for the last decade and have worked with the world’s leading brands to deploy innovative and market-leading AR solutions across the mobile web and native apps.

Prior to founding Zappar, Caspar spent 15 years as an account director and managing director of major advertising agencies, including one where he was a founding partner.

items.title: Ben Morrow
items.content: Ben is a passionate product leader for Augmented Reality and boundary mediums in general. His experience spans Interactive Television, Gaming, Experiential entertainment, Lightfield VR and Augmented Reality.

items.title: Nick Mountford
items.content: Nick provides strategic leadership to clients and the production team across Dreamwave and Active Theory projects.

items.title: Artur Sychov Live from Somnium Space
Artur Sychov
items.content: Artur Sychov is Founder and CEO of Somnium Space. He has been navigating virtual worlds for more than two decades starting with Ultima Online in 1999, then Second Life and many more. Artur strongly believes in the ultimate future of Virtual Reality worlds with open and decentralized economy.

items.title: Immersive E-Commerce and Crypto-Economic Infrastructure
items.content: The ability to take payments and conduct transactions securely on the Immersive Web isn’t in place yet but is essential to its growth. Blockchain and cryptocurrency, enablers of NFTs, offer new solutions to the next generation of e-commerce.

items.title: Luke Mulks
items.content: With experience in several startups, publishing and ad products, Luke was well equipped to join Brave in 2016 to begin developing new business models with privacy and blockchain. A co-author of the Basic Attention Token white paper, and core BAT team member Luke leads Business Operations at Brave and BAT, bringing new solutions to market that include privacy by default, backed with the benefits and empowerment that blockchain brings to web3.

items.title: Amy Peck
items.content:
Amy Peck is the Founder & CEO of EndeavorXR, a leading global XR strategy & consulting firm. She is a recognized thought-leader in the space and speaks globally on the future of XR and exponential technologies.
Amy holds multiple Advisory Board roles and is a Venture Partner at the Capital Region XR
Accelerator. She is Co-chair of Prospera Women, a global organization supporting female-led
startups and was Founding Co-chair of the VRAR Association Enterprise Committee.
She actively mentors entrepreneurs and is a member of several Women in Tech, Venture-backed Accelerators & STEM Education organizations.

Through EndeavorVR, she works with Fortune 500 companies and tech startups on XR strategy, content, development, product and GTM.

Her own personal mission is to see technology accessible to all - fundamentally improving every aspect of our lives and elevating the way we work, learn, communicate and play.

items.title: Jamie Burke
items.content:
Jamie is the CEO and founder of Outlier Ventures. He was an early investor in Bitcoin and Ethereum and founded Outlier Ventures, the Web 3.0 startup accelerator, in 2014. He is an active collector of NFTs and a passionate proponent of the Open Metaverse theory (you can read the thesis: https://outlierventures.io/research/the-open-metaverse-os/). The Open Metaverse thesis was created early 2021 after months of development, and acts as a toolkit to design alternatives based on principles of user centricity and sovereignty of identity, data and wealth.

Jamie is an active media commentator and has spoken on stages across the world about the breadth of opportunity Ethereum posses to serve as the foundation for the next generation of the internet. He is an active collector of NFTs, co-founding 100xARt, a community of the Top 200 collectors and has helped launch the world\'s first d-zine, NFTs.WTF, an independent NFT media property owned and controlled by a DAO of 100 industry leaders, creatives and influencers.

items.title: Leveraging Digital Twins For Businesses in Africa via WebXR
Arome Ibrahim
items.content:
Arome Ibrahim is a passionate 360° Virtual Reality Developer, Product Manager (XR), Digital Media Arts Creator and Impact Entrepreneur who strongly believes in utilising technology, more broadly, innovation to build and grow impact-based solutions in Africa.

He co-founded Experis Immersive - An Extended Reality (XR) content development agency creating immersive, innovative, and interactive experiences.

Arome is the team lead at Immersive Tech Africa, a creative non-profit organisation that leverages Extended Reality (XR) technologies to create impact-driven experiences and solutions that inspire global action toward the UN Sustainable Development Goals.

items.title: Where the WebXR Business Opportunities are Hiding
items.content:
- mid market companies
- security/vendor approvals
- leveraging already deployed services
- data privacy

items.title: Danny Stefanic
items.content:
Danny Stefanic is the creator of the world\'s first metaverse-for-business platform, spawning both MootUp for virtual events and LearnBrite for simulation and training. He is the inventor of the first 3D metaverse ExitReality, founder of the International Virtual Reality Association and chairman of the virtual worlds social network Koinup.

Called a "visionary" by his peers and deemed by Wall Street CIOs and Silicon Valley VCs to be "one of the pioneers in his field", he has been creating ground-breaking 3D businesses for over 29 years. Danny actively works with young businesses to share his experiences and give back to the community. He has assisted companies with angel investment, international licensing, acquisitions, exits, managing distributed teams and has personally closed IP acquisitions valued at $85MM.

items.title: Roadmap to WebXR Adoption
items.content: Billions have been invested and the hardware is coming. But when it gets here, will consumers have content? It’s time for the creative industries to match investment and have a plan to be ready to meet the coming demand.

items.title: Samantha Mathews
items.content:
Samantha Mathews is Founder & CEO; CTO of LOCI, a patented and neurologically proven safety training platform that transforms unstructured location and occupancy data into digital components that power a game engine that generates gamified content based on your environment. LOCI teaches people where to go and what to do to stay safe in places they visit and spend time regardless of age, language, or ability.

To Samantha, technology has always been a tool for connecting with people and improving lives. She builds by her belief that, instead of deepening our dependence on technology and letting it do the thinking for us, new systems should empower us to be more present, knowledgeable, and confident wherever we go.

items.title: Dulce Baerga
items.content:
Dulce Baerga has been producing interactive content for over 20 years. Building sites ranging from entertainment based portals to product based community sites. She’s a self-taught full stack developer, front-end engineer and network/IT manager who’s passionate about augmented reality and virtual reality platforms. Her skill set includes developing concepts, programming demos, creating UI/UX design, scripting user interactivity, building 3D simulations, creating virtual products, and building webXR apps.

She’s also an active resident of multiple virtual worlds, top prize winner at XR related hackathons, and deeply embedded in the XR community. Dulce is currently pushing the edges of the immersive web and augmented reality, creating XR MVPs for clients and collaboration projects. Immersive theater and mixed reality storytelling are two verticals of focus where she’s been creating production pipelines and UI/UX mechanics. Iterating on and streamlining new XR pipelines to create base MVPs is Dulce’s primary directive while pushing the XR envelope.

items.title: Jon Morris
items.content:
Conceptual artist who creates multilayered installations, performances, and experiences with the express intent of elevating his audience to a sublime state. Challenging the relationship between art and spectator Morris’ work is typically equal parts technical, playful, inventive and rich with depth. From Le Louvre to Lady Gaga from Cirque Du Soleil to the Metropolitan Opera, his work has been praised by NY Times, Wall Street Journal, LA Times, Rolling Stone, NBC, VICE, Wired.... Highlight works include; *[NOWHERE](http://www.urnowhere.com/)*, reimagining online gathering; [*Reflecting the Stars*](http://thewindmillfactory.com/?portfolio=reflecting-the-stars), recreating the night sky in the Hudson River; [Choreographing Nine Inch Nails](http://thewindmillfactory.com/?portfolio=nine-inch-nails-festival-tour) Festival Tour; [*Pixel Forest*](http://thewindmillfactory.com/?portfolio=pixel-forest), voice-illuminated balloon forest; [*The Wedge*](https://thewindmillfactory.com/portfolio/interactive-art-installation-burning-man-wedge/), a legendary slide/aerial-performance-center at Burning Man.

In addition to founding [The Windmill Factory](http://www.thewindmillfactory.com), Jon has performed and created with Fuerzabruta, Cirque du Soleil, The MET, Theatre de la Jeune Lune, Patrice Chereau, Robert Wilson, Tina Landau, Aszure Barton, Spymonkey, Diavolo Dance Theatre, Ken Roht’s Orphean Circus, Fabulous Monsters and Jay Scheib.  He has been featured in films by Jonathan Dayton and Valari Faris, David Michalek, and Anson Mount and starred in various national commercials and innumerable embarrassing gigs.

He has been a Thomas J. Watson Fellow, Kinnernet-Europe Experience Director, LaMaMa ETC Artist in residence, Watermill Center Fellow, Tennessee Williams Fellow, NCAA Post Graduate Scholar, 6-time All-American Springboard Diver, and holds a B.A. from the University of the South, Sewanee.  Jon has taught master classes at Harvard, NYU, Columbia, Pace, The University of The South, Vanderbilt.

items.title: Keram Malicki-Sánchez
items.content: Keram founded both VRTO & FIVARS in 2015. He’s a business and creative development consultant to a wide variety of tech companies, and founder of Constant Change Media Group Inc., with strong ties to both the Toronto & Los Angeles markets. He is also the editor in-chief of IndieGameReviewer.com, an instructor in WebXR design at UCLA Extension and author of essays around spatial media for several books. He won Creator of the Year at the 2022 Poly Awards, was named one of the Top 100 Original Voices in XR in 2021, and contributed to the 2022 PEW Research report on the Metaverse in 2040.

items.title: Kent Bye
items.content:
Since May 2014, Kent Bye has conducted over 1600 Voices of VR podcast interviews featuring the pioneering artists, storytellers, and technologists driving the resurgence of virtual & augmented reality. He's an oral historian, experiential journalist, & aspiring philosopher, helping to define the patterns of immersive storytelling, experiential design, ethical frameworks, & the ultimate potential of XR.

He's also been an executive committee member on the IEEE's Global Initiative on the Ethics of Extended Reality, which has been looking at mapping out the landscape of ethics for virtual and augmented reality. You can hear his latest thoughts on Twitter @kentbye.

items.title: Success Stories and Challenges of Early Adopters
items.content: “There’s gold in them thar hills.” Some startups have died crossing the prairies and mountains on the way to the promised land, while others have prospered and seized market share by building for the future. So much opportunity still lies ahead.

items.title: Samantha Mathews
items.content:
Samantha Mathews is Founder & CEO; CTO of LOCI, a patented and neurologically proven safety training platform that transforms unstructured location and occupancy data into digital components that power a game engine that generates gamified content based on your environment. LOCI teaches people where to go and what to do to stay safe in places they visit and spend time regardless of age, language, or ability.

To Samantha, technology has always been a tool for connecting with people and improving lives. She builds by her belief that, instead of deepening our dependence on technology and letting it do the thinking for us, new systems should empower us to be more present, knowledgeable, and confident wherever we go.

items.title: Daniel Meeks
items.content:
Daniel Meeks is an independent consultant specializing in immersive technology. His current work entails implementing augmented and virtual reality to visualize the battlespace for distributed simulator training with Battlespace Simulations, Inc.

Daniel is a former AC-130U Electronic Warfare Officer with eleven years of service in the USAF, and has ten years of experience designing, operating, and maintaining combat simulators around the world.

items.title: Tony Parisi
items.content:
Tony Parisi is a Metaverse and virtual reality pioneer, inventor, entrepreneur, investor, author and musician. He has co-created several international 3D graphics standards, including VRML, X3D, and glTF. Tony is the author of O’Reilly Media’s foundational books on 3D graphics and VR, Learning Virtual Reality (2015), Programming 3D Applications in HTML5 and WebGL (2014), and WebGL Up and Running (2012).

One of the leading spokespeople for the immersive industry, Tony has given speeches in multiple countries about industry trends and innovation in augmented reality. He was named in Next Reality’s 30 People to Watch in Augmented Reality in 2020.

Tony is currently serving as Chief Strategy Officer at Lamina1, a new layer 1 blockchain for the Metaverse. He is also an advisor and limited partner in early stage venture firms including ME Ventures, a future-focused investment fund providing opportunities for creators to grow and succeed. Previously, Tony was Head of XR Ads and E-Commerce at Unity, where he oversaw strategy and product for the company’s real-time 3D brand advertising and commerce solutions.

Tony is also a composer and musician. He is currently finishing the cast recording for Judgment Day, a full-length original musical, and has several other music projects underway.

items.title: Larry Rosenthal
items.content:
LarryR/Cube3 has pioneered many of the current disciplines in \"digital media\" known as XR/ VR / AR 3DUX. UI, Experience Design,Transmedia and Immersive media.

LarryR/Cube3 has over two decades of experience as a leader in the area of virtual worlds , transmedia IP creation, Virtual Reality content, Virtual IP Law, social games, online 3D, human machine interface, Augmented Reality and networked communities for both entertainment and corporate media uses. Over the years LarryR/Cube3 has worked with over hundreds of 2D /3D software tools makers or services in all matters of finding customers and creating products and services and then forming communities and ecosystems around them.

LarryR/Cube3 has spoken at industry events for over two decades. Highlights include self created seminars at Apple Computers NYC, Siggraphs for many years, Macworlds, and Digital Hollywood Panels as well as local east and west coast tech/design shows/meetings and conferences. Work and projects of LarryR/Cube3 have been written about in both print and online in periodicals such as WIRED, UploadVR, NEW MEDIA, Macworld, CNET, and two zillion blogs. He also founded the early VR Groups for developers and designers. The NYVRMLSIG, the SFWEB3D.
Currently CubeXR is creating an online web3D Educational Community and Platform www ArdadiaVirtual.com

items.title: Removing Friction to Reaching Consumers and Customers
items.content: Taking an “Immersive First” approach to UX Design is necessary to attain and keep the engagement of the mass consumer market entering XR, requiring a complete rethink of sales to production pipelines with new creative and technical challenges.

items.title: Joanna Popper
items.content:
Joanna Popper is an award-winning Hollywood and Silicon Valley media executive with a track record of launching cutting edge content and technology to drive revenue, audience engagement and brand love.

She currently leads HP’s Virtual Reality initiatives for Go-To-Market and Location Based Entertainment. Prior she was EVP of Media & Marketing at Singularity University and VP Marketing at NBCUniversal.

Joanna is Executive Producer on “Breonna’s Garden” which premiered at the Tribeca Festival. This augmented reality experience was created by Lady PhoEnix and Sutu with Ju’Niyah Palmer to honor the life of her sister, Breonna Taylor.

Joanna was Executive Producer on Double Eye Studios’ “Finding Pandora X,” winner of Venice Film Festival Golden Lion for Best VR Experience and the SXSW Audience Award for Virtual Cinema Spotlight. Finding Pandora X is a modern day take on Greek mythology live interactive experience in VRChat.

Joanna was selected as “50 Women Can Change the World in Media and Entertainment,” “Top 50 Original Thinkers in VR,” “Top Women in Media: Game Changers,” “Top Women in Media: Industry Leaders,” “Digital It List,” “101 Women Leading the VR Industry” and is on the Coalition for the Women in XR Fund.

items.title: Jeremy Dalton
items.content:
Jeremy is the author of Reality Check: How Immersive Technologies Can Transform Your Business, a book that anyone can pick up to better understand how virtual reality and augmented reality are being used in businesses all over the world.

He has featured in The Financial Times, The Economist, the BBC, and other media outlets. He has worked with organizations like the World Economic Forum and currently sits on the advisory board of Immerse UK to support businesses interested in immersive technologies.

items.title: Eren Aksu
items.content:
Eren Aksu is an AR/VR Subject Matter Expert and Senior Manager at Deloitte Digital. He brings together technical product management, sales and business development, marketing, strategy and production management experiences focused on the xR industry. His previous projects include dozens of virtual reality, augmented reality and mixed reality launches and releases in collaboration with companies like Google, Facebook, WSJ, SoCal Edison, Chevron and other global brands.

Mr. Aksu has been in the xR space since 2011 and joined Deloitte in 2018 after his role at Emblematic as the 2nd full time employee helping the startup scale exponentially. He helped bootstrap Emblematic with its founders at the Interactive Media Research Lab at USC and was selected as 1 of 10 “VR for Good” film makers by Facebook/Oculus for Facebook’s inaugural “VR for Good” program. The resulting xR film became part of the official selection for SXSW (South by South West) and several other film festivals around the world. After joining Deloitte in 2018, he was selected by Deloitte\'s CIO to lead the Deloitte Digital Reality (DxR) incubation and innovation hub reporting directly to the Deloitte CIO and CTO, and he now serves the US Navy as the AR Lead for their 5G Navy Smart Warehouse project in San Diego.

Mr. Aksu also leads multiple innovation related efforts at Deloitte, such as helping build out and leading content/frontier tech asset curation for Deloitte’s Houston Innovation Center focused on Energy, Resources, and Industrials. He is a frequent speaker and presenter on xR topics at events and conferences globally and is an Advisor at Deloitte’s Startup Deloitte program focused on fostering startup innovation inside Deloitte. He has an extensive network of startups and companies he collaborates with and is also the Co-Founder of Nextopic, a virtual conference series focused on introducing frontier technologies and their impacts on different higher-level topics to audiences around the world. Some of their recent conferences have included Nextopic: Future of Pandemics and Nextopic: Future of Work, which have featured dozens of speakers and thought leaders such as Salman Khan, Founder & CEO of Khan Academy.

items.title: Tom Emrich
items.content:
Tom is recognized as one of the world’s leading thought leaders in augmented reality (AR), virtual reality (VR) & wearable technology. A pioneer in this space, Tom has over a decade-long track record of running tech teams and providing strategic direction in emerging technologies for powerhouse brands and organizations. As VP of Product at 8th Wall, Tom is leading the strategy and development of powerful tools used by developers to create reality content (WebAR and WebVR) for the browser. Previous to 8th Wall, Tom was a founding partner at Super Ventures, the first VC fund dedicated to augmented reality.

He also played a critical role in building the AR/VR ecosystem as founder of We Are Wearables and co-producer of AWE, the world’s #1 AR+VR event series.

items.title: Immersive Data Storytelling
items.content: A powerful set of use cases that captures the hearts and minds.

items.title: Jason Marsh
items.content: Jason Marsh is the technical founder and CEO of Flow Immersive, a company focused on Data Storytelling with WebXR. Jason is obsessed with the brain science around how we can build better mental models of our data and information, understanding the limitations of slideware, and encoding better science into a product for anyone to build data presentations.

items.title: Interoperability Across the Metaverse
items.content: Saying Metaverses is like saying Internets, there can be only one.  Initiatives are underway to standardize travel between worlds, reducing friction and increasing freedom for virtual travelers. Interoperability is what will make the Metaverse a success.

items.title: Evo Heyning
items.content:
Evo Heyning has been creating immersive experiences that bridge real and virtual worlds for more than 20 years. As an interactive showrunner and production strategist, she has worked on media projects ranging from launching the Affordable Care Act to producing more than 500 hours of livestreaming events during the pandemic. Her work focuses on metaverse media and the creative potential of volumetric and virtual production.

Evo passionately shapes the future of the open spatial web to connect people and groundbreaking, applicable ideas through collaborative technologies. Through her company Playable Agency, Evo provides early stage production strategy and creative worldbuilding that expand reality.

items.title: Robert Long
items.content: Robert is passionate about defending the open metaverse. He has worked on social VR at AltspaceVR and Mozilla Hubs. Now Robert is working at Element on decentralized communications and co-chairing the Open Metaverse Interoperability Group.

items.title: Alina Kadlubsky
items.content: Alina is an Art Director Design Researcher, WebXR Developer; Director of Communications of the Open AR Cloud Association and Managing Director of Open AR Cloud Europe gUG as well as Lead Strategist of the Cyber XR Coalition. With a passion for immersive Tech, Spatial Computing, Spatial Web and creating a human centered future of Computing.

items.title: Timmu Tõke
items.content: Timmu Tõke is the CEO of Ready Player Me, a cross-game avatar platform integrated with 400+ games and apps across the metaverse. Forbes 30 Under 30.

items.title: Anticipating Disruption, Let History Be Our Guide
items.content: The lessons of Web 1.0 and Web 2.0 should be fresh in our memory and applied to the foundation of the Immersive Web.

items.title: Julie Smithson
items.content:
Julie Smithson’s personal mission is to ‘inspire and educate people to think and act in a socially, economically and environmentally responsible way’.

It is through this lens as co-founder at MetaVRse, a 3D Web game engine for Business & XR development company.  Julie is leading enterprise companies to digitally transform and educate ways to immersive and remotely train users of the product/service. Julie guides her team to translate instructional language, interaction behaviors and curate knowledge testing gamification for businesses.  

Julie’s leadership is focused on transforming training & marketing into immersive experiences using technologies to design Web3 solutions, integration implementation and deployment to produce growth benefits, cost savings and human efficiencies.

Julie is also co-Chair of XRWomen.com , a global group of women who meet every Wednesday and learn about the applications of extended realities.  The group works to advocate, inspire and build communities aimed at inclusivity of gender equality, race and ethnicity in the digital sector and beyond.  

Julie is the host of the XR For Learning podcast. Julie also leads XR Collaboration, a coalition supporting human connectivity through digital presence in platforms building communication and collaboration.  Julie is also founder of XR Ignite to support the innovation and entrepreneurship of our communities. She also sits on panels and in leading conversations about interoperability standards and alignments with Khronos Group and MetaTr@versal.  

Previous to MetaVRse, Julie was Co-Founder of Emulator, the World’s most advanced DJ system, which won the prestigious 2011 DJ Mag Innovative Product Award.  She scored a $500K deal on the hit TV show Dragons’ Den. 

Julie is the co-host of the WebXR Summit series and a renowned speaker on XR and Produced TEDx Toronto (2010) and introduced coding in VR at Canada Learns Code (2017). She is past-President of the VRARA Toronto Chapter and Former Chair of the VRARA Education and Student Committees. Most recently Julie presented with the YPO, Harvard and 1Society about changing the way we learn and teach using spatial technologies.

items.title: Ritesh Patel
items.content:
Ritesh is as a digital and social evangelist who has been evangelizing digital since the early days of the dot com boom in the late 1990\'s. Early in his career, he joined Agency.com and quickly began to consult with major fortune 500 companies to evangelize the merits of the World Wide Web.

Along the way, he worked for the likes of Havas, Cushman & Wakefield and began a deep dive into the healthcare arena in 2009 when he joined Inventiv Health as Head of Digital & Innovation. There, he was a pioneer in the use of the emerging social media platforms, winning a CLIO award in 2010 for the Novartis Tobi Facebook page under the category of “Best Use of Social Media in 2010” for that work.

He is a Senior Partner, Global Digital Health at FINN Partners, a marketing agency in New York where he focuses on all things digital for clients.

items.title: Forest Gibson
items.content:
Forest is a co-founder and Chief Product Officer at Pluto VR. The company’s purpose is to help humanity transcend physical location so that everyone can more easily connect, communicate, and collaborate as if they were in person regardless of where they are. Before co-founding Pluto VR he was a creative innovations leader at Deloitte Digital, working with the largest brands in the world to help them stay competitive in the new digital landscape.

He has a diverse background including VR, film, marketing, and crowdfunding. Other projects Include: An automated brewing machine kickstarter that makes beer at the press of a button, a new way to train employees through mobile gaming, and the web series Know Your Meme.

items.title: Terry xR. Schussler
items.content: Terry works in Group Partnering and Devices serving all global business units and natcos with strategy, partner management, technology and trend scouting, technical research and developer engagement. He focuses on metaverse topics: spatial computing, 5G, edge computing, AI, cryptocurrency, NFTs and related emerging technologies. Terry leads Deutsche Telekom’s XR hardware and software scouting and metaverse ecosystem activities with key global partners. As an official Telekom Ambassador he brings the passion and spirit of #TeamMagenta to everyone!

items.title: Sophia Moshasha
items.content:
Sophia Moshasha is on a mission to accelerate the adoption of immersive & emerging technologies. Behind the scenes, on camera, and on stage, Sophia is a driving force behind numerous initiatives designed to advance knowledge and engagement with XR across all sectors.

As a producer of The Polys - WebXR Awards and host of its Virtual Red Carpet, Special Correspondent of the WebXR Summit Series and co-host of the VRARA podcast, Sophia has interviewed dozens of XR pioneers and innovators. As a fellow of MetaTr@versal, an initiative to advocate for cooperation among the stakeholders of the Metaverse on standards and interoperability, Sophia was the star of a 40 minute, 3-act play which was performed live on the Main Stage at AWE 2022, which featured a cast of industry heavyweights. She is a co-founder of XR Women, a global collective dedicated to the advancement of female representation in technology.  Sophia will host the WebXR Brand Summit on September 15.

Since 2018, Sophia has been the Vice President of the DC Chapter of the VR/AR Association’s Washington, D.C. Chapter. Sophia is also the co-founder and Chief Marketing Officer for Ready Player Golf, the first annual Virtual Reality Charity Golf Outing, which began in 2020, and has raised money for MSF (Doctors Without Borders) and XRSI (the XR Safety Initiative). She has served as Head of Partnerships for Brightline Interactive, XR Strategist for Virtual Reality Marketing, and in Executive Program support for AFWERX, the US Air Force’s Innovation Investment Program. 


Sophia has been influencing global networks through many years of active engagement in the XR community. She has been featured on prominent media outlets such as Forbes, ABC, CGTN, American Dream TV series and more She holds a Bachelor of Science from Virginia Commonwealth University. She is currently engaged in public policy planning for Meta.

items.title: Gabe Baker
items.content: Gabe is a product manager and developer who has worked somewhere at the intersection of education, immersive technology, and collaborative tools for the past 10 years. He lives in Southern California, creates instrumental music in his free time, and enjoys working with curious, passionate people.

items.title: WebXR Brand Summit
items.content:
The WebXR Brand Summit is an all-day virtual event with a long list of innovators who will share their insights on the paradigm shift of advertising in the immersive medium. Strategic discussions on a range of topics including Immersive AdTech, V-Commerce, Fashion and Luxury, Branded Events, Making your Brand Metaverse Ready, Intellectual Property, and more.

We're honored to be welcoming XR Innovation thought leaders including: Amy Peck, Tony Parisi, Alan Smithson, D.J. Smith, Kent Bye, Avi Bar-Zeev, Athena Demos, Anne-Marie Enns, Andy Fidel, Dulce Baerga, Valerie Vacante, Briar Prestidge, Veronica Costa Orvalho, Daniel Dyboski-Bryant, Karen Alexander, Gary Fearnall, Katitza Rodriguez Pereda, Aura Freeman, Vanitha Swaminathan, James Kaplan, Richard Ward, Jake Steinerman, Evan Gappelberg, Han Kim, Linda Ricci, Kiira, Benzing, Cynthia Maller, Bobby Carlton, Marco Cavalho, Celeste Lear, Benno K. Erhardt, Will Knecht, Ashley Crowder, Elijah Tai, Sonya Haskins Daria Fedko, Brian Hutchinson, Terry Proto, Samantha G. Wolfe, Tom Ffiske and more!

Register at https://bit.ly/WebXRBrandSummitTix for join info on where to watch and join our 5 VR Watch Parties in the Metaverse

items.title: Welcome to the WebXR Brand Summit
items.content: WebXR Summit Series creator Ben Erwin welcomes host Sophia Moshasha and the audience to our fifth event. This one is built to be a catalyst for accelerating investment in the Immersive Web through educating the marketing and advertising community.

items.title: Ben Erwin
items.content:
Championing XR Industry Advancement through Leadership, Collaboration, and Innovation

As the creator of The Polys - WebXR Awards, WebXR Summit Series, and MetaTr@versal, Ben Erwin has made a lasting impact on the XR industry by catalyzing awareness and engagement with the immersive web. With over three decades of experience as an internet frontiersman, he has been instrumental in advancing the industry through the recognition of its pioneers and providing advocacy platforms for thought leaders.

Ben's diverse background includes serving as a developer and executive for digital media agencies, where he created data-driven interactives for numerous major brands. In addition, he dedicated 13 years as a webmaster and consultant for the United Nations humanitarian section and partner NGOs, raising awareness for women and children in conflict areas worldwide.

A digital polymath, Ben's expertise spans marketing, management, programming, video editing, and writing. His experience in the browser wars led him to collaborate with XR industry leadership in producing the MetaTr@versal series of events. These gatherings galvanize the community around cooperation on the development and adoption of open standards and platform interoperability for the Metaverse.

Passionate about the potential of immersive content as a positive means for evolved human communication in areas like civics, journalism, and education, Ben shines a light on innovators' good works to preserve their legacy and inspire others to build upon it.

With a network of over 10,500 LinkedIn followers and 9,500 connections, Ben Erwin exemplifies dedication to the XR industry's growth, championing its advancement through leadership, collaboration, and innovation.

items.title: Opening Remarks
items.content: Host Sophia Moshasha previews the exciting day ahead where we will explore the frontier of immersive marketing, advertising, sales, and commerce.

items.title: Sophia Moshasha
items.content:
Sophia Moshasha is on a mission to accelerate the adoption of immersive & emerging technologies. Behind the scenes, on camera, and on stage, Sophia is a driving force behind numerous initiatives designed to advance knowledge and engagement with XR across all sectors.

As a producer of The Polys - WebXR Awards and host of its Virtual Red Carpet, Special Correspondent of the WebXR Summit Series and co-host of the VRARA podcast, Sophia has interviewed dozens of XR pioneers and innovators. As a fellow of MetaTr@versal, an initiative to advocate for cooperation among the stakeholders of the Metaverse on standards and interoperability, Sophia was the star of a 40 minute, 3-act play which was performed live on the Main Stage at AWE 2022, which featured a cast of industry heavyweights. She is a co-founder of XR Women, a global collective dedicated to the advancement of female representation in technology.  Sophia will host the WebXR Brand Summit on September 15.

Since 2018, Sophia has been the Vice President of the DC Chapter of the VR/AR Association’s Washington, D.C. Chapter. Sophia is also the co-founder and Chief Marketing Officer for Ready Player Golf, the first annual Virtual Reality Charity Golf Outing, which began in 2020, and has raised money for MSF (Doctors Without Borders) and XRSI (the XR Safety Initiative). She has served as Head of Partnerships for Brightline Interactive, XR Strategist for Virtual Reality Marketing, and in Executive Program support for AFWERX, the US Air Force’s Innovation Investment Program. 


Sophia has been influencing global networks through many years of active engagement in the XR community. She has been featured on prominent media outlets such as Forbes, ABC, CGTN, American Dream TV series and more She holds a Bachelor of Science from Virginia Commonwealth University. She is currently engaged in public policy planning for Meta.

items.title: Parsing The Metaverse Hype
items.content: Sophia welcomes Amy Peck, one of the Metaverse's leading content experts, for an essential conversation on what brands need to know to navigate the paradigm shift into the spatial medium.

items.title: Sophia Moshasha
items.content:
Sophia Moshasha is on a mission to accelerate the adoption of immersive & emerging technologies. Behind the scenes, on camera, and on stage, Sophia is a driving force behind numerous initiatives designed to advance knowledge and engagement with XR across all sectors.
