Dr. Alexander is committed to women’s advancement and gender and racial equality and believes in a Humanity First approach to XR and the metaverse. She holds master’s degrees in English, Philosophy, and Issues in Modern Culture and earned her PhD. at the University of London.

items.title: Jonathon Richter
items.content: Jonathon Richter is the founding CEO and President of the Immersive Learning Research Network - or iLRN - a nonprofit educational research and innovation network for the public to discover, share, and innovate on "what works" in XR and Immersive Learning.

items.title: Chris Dede
items.content:
Chris Dede is the Timothy E. Wirth Professor in Learning Technologies at Harvard’s Graduate School of Education (HGSE). His fields of scholarship include emerging technologies, policy, and leadership. From 2001-2004, he was Chair of the HGSE department of Teaching and Learning. In 2007, he was honored by Harvard University as an outstanding teacher, and in 2011 he was named a Fellow of the American Educational Research Association.

In 2020 Chris co-founded the Silver Lining for Learning initiative (https://silverliningforlearning.org). He is currently a Member of the OECD 2030 Scientific Committee and an Advisor to the Alliance for the Future of Digital Learning, sponsored by the Mohammed bin Rashid Global Initiative (MBRGI). Also, Chris is a Co-Principal Investigator of the NSF-funded National Artificial Intelligence Institute in Adult Learning and Online Education.

His most recent co-edited books include: Teacher Learning in the Digital Age: Online Professional Development in STEM Education; Virtual, Augmented, and Mixed Realities in Education; Learning engineering for online education: Theoretical contexts and design-based examples; and The 60-Year Curriculum: New Models for Lifelong Learning in the Digital Economy.

items.title: Maya Georgieva
items.content:
Maya Georgieva is a futurist and Metaverse strategist, author, and speaker with more than 15 years of experience in higher education, industry consulting, global communities, and human rights policy. Her most recent work focuses on innovation, the metaverse, immersive storytelling, VR/AR experiences, design thinking, and digital strategy. Maya actively writes and speaks on the topics of the metaverse, immersive storytelling, and the future of learning, creativity, and work and consults organizations and startups in this space. She is an XR producer and serves as a judge and coach for several competitions and accelerator programs.

Maya is the Senior Director of the Innovation Center and XR, AI, and Quantum Labs at The New School. She leads a team driving new media and innovation focused on immersive storytelling, spatial computing, future interfaces, and design. Maya teaches the signature Immersive Storytelling course at Parsons School of Design. Maya often speaks about the Metaverse and frontier technologies like AI and Quantum and speculative futures. Her work has been featured at SXSW, the MIT Media Lab, The Atlantic, The Economist, and the Fulbright Program, among others. She is the co-author and principal investigator of the State of XR and Immersive Learning Report. She has authored white papers on the future of education and immersive learning in EDUCAUSE Review, The Chronicle of Higher Education, EdSurge, and other publications.

items.title: Empowering Teachers with XR Tools
items.content: In this practice-focused panel, leading XR educators discuss the most effective tools available for use in the classroom and how teachers can employ them in lessons.

items.title: Paula MacDowell
items.content: Paula MacDowell, PhD, is an Assistant Professor at the University of Saskatchewan, specializing in Educational Technology and Design. Her ongoing research focuses on designing technology-enhanced learning experiences for K-12, higher education, and informal learning contexts. In collaboration with academic, industry, and community partners, Paula studies the design of immersive learning experiences for pro-social and environmental change. She serves as the Practitioner Chair for the Immersive Learning Research Network (iLRN).

items.title: Kai Frazier
items.content:
Kai Frazier is an educator turned EdTech entrepreneur passionate about using tech to provide opportunities for underestimated communities.

She is the founder & CEO of Kai XR, which uses Metaverse technologies to develop critical 21st century skills in students preparing them for a rapidly evolving future. Kai also serves as Global Child Safety & Education Adviser for the XR Safety Initiative, XRSI.

Before creating Kai XR, she worked with several museums such as the United States Holocaust Memorial Museum as well as the Smithsonian National Museum of African American History & Culture, specializing in digital strategy and content creation.
Her company is backed by Techstars & T-Mobile and has been featured in Forbes, NBC, the Steve Harvey Show & more.

items.title: Steven Bambury
items.content:
Steve Bambury has worked in education and training for 20 years. In 2016 he became the first Head of Digital Learning and Innovation across the JESS school group before moving on to work as an education consultant in 2019. This included an extended engagement within New Media Academy where he led on education strategy and immersive technology and coordinated the deployment of the first virtual campus in The Middle East.

Steve has won awards from Apple, Microsoft, GESS, BETT and EdTech Digest for his working integrating technology in learning and professional development. In 2017, he hosted the world’s first professional development sessions inside virtual reality and in 2018 he co-hosted the world’s first global lesson inside VR alongside Pixar co-founder Loren Carpenter. Steve is on the judging panel for both the GESS Awards and World VR Awards and his work with VR has been featured on Forbes Middle East, Arabian Business, Dubai One and more.

Steve now works as a consultant and project manager in the field of NFTs, Web3 and the Metaverse.

items.title: Corinne Brenner
items.content:
Corinne Brenner is Director of Learning at Killer Snails, where she helps create and study games that inspire a love of science. Killer Snails’ most recent project is WaterWays, an augmented reality app that helps students connect the impact humans have on water, and water’s impact on people. She is also a PhD candidate in NYU’s Educational Communication and Technology program, where she uses a variety of methods to understand how virtual reality can be used effectively in education.

Corinne is an author of numerous academic publications examining the affordances of immersive technology for education and entertainment. She received her BA in Psychology from Cornell University, and MSc in Social Psychology and Psychological Methods from the University of Amsterdam.

items.title: Transforming Education in Africa
items.content: The African continent is rich in opportunities to build new educational models from the ground up and to prepare its young and growing population for a future in which XR is a primary computing platform. Experts from the continent will talk about their initiatives and key considerations.

items.title: Arome Ibrahim
items.content:
Arome Ibrahim is a passionate 360° Virtual Reality Developer, Product Manager (XR), Digital Media Arts Creator and Impact Entrepreneur who strongly believes in utilising technology, more broadly, innovation to build and grow impact-based solutions in Africa.

He co-founded Experis Immersive - An Extended Reality (XR) content development agency creating immersive, innovative, and interactive experiences.

Arome is the team lead at Immersive Tech Africa, a creative non-profit organisation that leverages Extended Reality (XR) technologies to create impact-driven experiences and solutions that inspire global action toward the UN Sustainable Development Goals.

items.title: Grace Kebirungi
items.content:
Ms Grace Kebirungi possesses a Masters degree in Microbiology and Quality Control (Virology and Bacteriology) and a BSc in Fundamental and Applied Microbiology, from the University of Science and Technology Houari Boumediene Algiers, Algeria through an Algerian government scholarship in collaboration with the Ministry of Education in Uganda.

She is passionate about innovations in health and was part of the team that pioneered training of frontline health workers in COVID-19 Infection Prevention and Control using virtual reality technology. She is instrumental in VR ideation and content creation, writes scripts and works together with the technical team at ACE to transform health science courses into virtual reality training courses. She is a strong advocate for virtual reality and does this through virtual reality application training. She also has competences in bioinformatics, unix programming language and basic understanding of python programming

items.title: Walid Kilonzi
items.content: A pioneering Extended Reality Producer and a Creative Director with a knack for telling stories, a flair for detail, and a hint of humour. I have a proven and experienced background in 360 productions, Augmented Reality, Mixed Reality, simulations, 360 animations and VR games for multinational companies, SMEs, African governments and NGOs based all around Africa.

items.title: Isiaq Gbadamosi
items.content:
Isiaq is the co-founder and head of growth at SwiftXR, a cross-platform builder tool that allows users and businesses to create WebXR content without having to write code. SwiftXR is used by companies in the real estate, art, education, and e-commerce industries to develop lightweight WebAR experiences.

He\'s also on the advisory board of the VRAR Association, Nigeria Chapter, a global community promoting virtual and augmented reality technologies in Nigeria and aims to democratize access to VR/AR learning resources. Isiaq is dedicated to expanding the extended reality (AR and VR) community of users, enthusiasts, and developers.

items.title: Job Oyebisi
items.content:
Job is the founder of StanLab Ltd, an education technology company that is leveraging immersive technology to build learning solutions to create access to quality education for all students no matter their background. Stanlab builds 3D interactive, virtual laboratory application that provides practical science education to students especially those who do not have access to traditional laboratories in resource-constrianed settings.

He is the 2018 Winner of the Global #IdeasChangeLives Competition organized by British Council and a top education innovator as recognized by Deloitte and World Economic Forum in the #WorldClass Education Challenge.

items.title: Championing Arts and Humanities in Tech-Enabled Education
items.content: XR education is not all about STEM. In fact, the affordances of XR make it highly effective for teaching arts and humanities. Experienced educators talk about how they have adopted XR to teach these subjects.

items.title: Carlos J. Ochoa Fernandez
items.content:
Carlos J. Ochoa Fernandez:

Engineer from Madrid Polytechnic University, MBA from Babson College, Certificate in Innovation and Entrepreneurship by Maryland University, Certificate in Digital Marketing for International Business Development (ICEX), and ITC & Gis Certificate by Siemens Data-Technic Schule (Germany).

President VRAR Madrid Chapter, Co-Chair of Education Committee, Immersive Learning Founding Member, ICICLE X-Reality for Learning and Performance Augmentation SIG, Member of Educators in VR, Member of Smart Cities Experts and Standards Group of AENOR (Spain),
Expert Evaluator for the European Commission in XR Projects and Technologies.

With over 25 years of international experience in the Innovation and New Advance Digital Technologies in the ITC Industry and Digital Education. Leading successful organizations (SIEMENS, Sagentia, Altran, Founder and CEO of E_Learning Consulting, ONE Digital Consulting & SmartEducationLabs, with a balanced strategic mission and innovative business development vision.

Author of the White Paper “Best Practices in VR in Education” and “State of Art of XR in Education” by VR/AR Association and Member of Several Experts Committees in XR in Training, Education, Training, Cultural Heritage, Tourism and Smart Cities

items.title: Nyambura M. Waruingi
items.content: Nyambura M. Waruingi is the Founder and Creative Director of Akoia & Company. She creates, curates, produces, and collaborates across various artistic expressions, encountering unique ways to imagine new worlds through immersive storytelling, and focusing on producing extended reality experiences. She curates #ImmersiveJuaKali conversations, which bring together XR practitioners from Africa and around the world.

items.title: Lucia Binotti
items.content: I investigate how the affordances of XR experiences – such as interactivity, visualization, goal-directed activity, and presence – can be leveraged to promote more effective learning specifically in humanistic and linguistic subjects. On one hand, I am interested in understanding how user activity in an XR experience generates mental narratives that help learners structure, organize, and process culturally and linguistically situated knowledge. On the other, I am designing procedures and evaluative tools to define and assess the learning that occurs in interdisciplinary teams of students, faculty and staff who integrate Immersive in their work. I am looking at how the activity of these teams can be configured to project-based learning, and how this learning can be used to complement or challenge existing post-secondary pedagogical approaches to language, culture and heritage learning.

items.title: Michael McDonald
items.content:
After a combined 20 years of studying and teaching foreign languages, Michael McDonald created Gold Lotus which aims to demonstrate how virtual reality can support the learning and teaching of foreign languages.

Recent projects include the launch of the Handy English VR vocabulary-building app, a 24-hour VR English lesson and cultural event to raise funds for the fight against Covid and programs in schools around the world aimed at raising awareness of how VR can be used to develop language skills and cultural awareness, with particular focus on students building their own webXR spaces to share their local cultural heritage in a unique VR exchange program. His most recent course in partnership with VictoryXR has just concluded on the ENGAGE VR platform - Public Speaking in a Multicultural World.

items.title: Assessing Learning for the Age of XR
items.content: New learning tools require new means of assessment. And XR permits the collection of data that encompasses much more than was previously possible.

items.title: Jennifer Rogers
items.content: Jennifer Rogers is an experienced Learning & Talent Development executive with a demonstrated history of strategic workforce transformation and capability development. She specializes in workforce optimization and acceleration utilizing a unique combination of emerging technologies and data analytics and has led large strategic initiatives in several global, high risk-high compliance industries, including oil and gas, mining, aviation, and financial services. Jennifer is passionate about leading cutting edge innovation in the learning space, with particular attention to strategies that proactively prepare the workforce for the future of work, and currently serves as VP of Learning and Development at RPM Living, a rapid-growth-stage real estate firm, as well as lends her expertise as an Executive Officer of IEEE’s Learning Technology Standards Committee.

items.title: Enabling Different Abilities with XR Content
items.content: Immersive learning can unlock potential for Special Education and people with different abilities, such as autism or those with mobility and cognitive impairments. The panel of experts explore success stories of how XR empowers those left behind in traditional education.

items.title: Muhsinah Morris
items.content:
VR Enthusiast, Innovator, Educator, Speaker, Autism Advocate, Author, Wife, Mom

Muhsinah L. Holmes Morris, Ph.D is the former Interim Department Chair/Assistant Professor of Chemistry and is now in the Department of Education and Assistant Professor of Education for the Center of Morehouse Center for Excellence in Education (MCEE) at Morehouse College in Atlanta, GA. Dr. Morris is Morehouse College’s 2021 Winner of the Vulcan Teaching Award of Excellence.

She is an alumna of Clark Atlanta University (B.S.) and Emory University (M.S. & PhD). Her research interests focus on inclusion in STEM for the neurodiverse. She is the Principal Investigator (PI) of the VR Project, “Morehouse in the Metaverse”. She launched her Advanced Inorganic Chemistry course in Virtual Reality in the Spring of 2021. She is a pioneer in this space as the chemistry content in VR is limited.

She is the wife of a gamer/techie named Chris and mom of 5 sons, Anthony, Matthew, Christopher, Seth and Cameron. She believes VR provides a pathway for creating inclusion in society for the neurodivergent through immersive educational experiences that more specifically target vocational rehabilitation goals. As a member of the Autism Speaks Community Advisory Council, Advocacy Ambassadors, and Grant Review Committee, Dr. Morris sheds light on the issues that affect the 1 in 44 children and 1 in 45 adults on the autism spectrum. Her teaching philosophy centers around building a rapport with students before asking them to perform, and she infuses metacognitive goals as part of her learning objectives in the classroom to help students persist through their educational experiences.

She is affectionately known as Dr. M.O.M. (Molder of Minds) by all her students. She continues to mold the minds of educators and students globally in the Metaverse. Her future is authentic transformation of the educational system for our future leaders using immersive technologies in the Metaverse. More recently, she founded Metaverse United, LLC where she helps people find where they belong in the embodiment of the internet called the Metaverse. Learn more at UnitetheMetaverse.

items.title: Jasmine Clark
items.content:
Jasmine Clark is the Digital Scholarship Librarian at Temple University. Her primary areas of research are accessibility and metadata in emerging technology and emerging technology centers. Currently, she is leading The Virtual Blockson, a project to recreate and gamify the Charles L. Blockson Afro-American Collection in virtual reality to teach high school students primary literacy skills. She is also doing research in 3D metadata and the development of Section 508 compliant guidelines for virtual reality experiences.

She is also the chair of the DLF Digital Accessibility Working Group, as well as a Co-Chair of the DLF Committee for Equity and Inclusion.

items.title: Dylan Fox
items.content: Dylan is a UX design and accessibility consultant specializing in virtual, mixed, and augmented reality (XR). As the Coordination and Engagement Team lead for XR Access, he helps organizations invested in XR stay up-to-date on the latest accessibility guidelines and helps find solutions to novel accessibility challenges. He also conducts ongoing research at UC Berkeley on how AR can be used to help people with visual impairments.

items.title: Anna Xygkou
items.content:
Anna Xygkou is a PhD candidate and researcher in the Department of Computing at the University of Kent, UK. After receiving her MSc in Language and Communication Impairments in Children (University of Sheffield, UK) and her MSc in Statistics and Research Methods (University of Kent, UK), she delved into researching the application of immersive technologies and specifically Virtual Reality, to improve the quality of life of diverse populations (autistic children and adults), as well as groups who are vulnerable to social isolation. Companionship and Social Connectedness through/with Conversational Virtual Humans (CVHs) has been her core research interest, especially when those entities can co-exist with any other physical/artificial entities in any type of context and environment. Her current research interests include conversational AI and Human-Robot Interaction for socially deprived/challenged groups.

She was the founder of AUTISM VR Channel in AltspaceVR and the moderator of the Diversity Track in the Educators in VR International Summit Virtual Conference 2020.

items.title: ADA Compliance for Immersive Education
items.content: Government funding for education comes with a mandate for accessibility. Failure to account for the needs of the differently abled could potentially expose institutions to lawsuits. Roland Dubois, a leading educator on WebXR and accessibility shares what you need to know to make sure your program serves the needs of everyone, in compliance with governmental regulation.

items.title: Roland Dubois
items.content:
Roland is a product designer and UX expert based in NYC, curator of WebXRNews.com, XR Accessibility at Virtuleap, and creator of GRAVR — a globally recognized avatar for VR on the web. Previously, Roland co-founded the consulting agency ByteDept, designing human-centric digital products for some of the world’s most respected brands in a variety of verticals. He is the host of WebXR (A-Frame NYC) workshops/events and creates immersive experiments that make the current VR/AR industry accessible for everyone.

He started his design career in the Siemens/BenQ innovations lab. A graduate of the University of Applied Sciences Munich, Roland is an adjunct faculty teacher for immersive design at the School of Visual Arts, NYC. He is also a member of the W3C Immersive Web CG and XR Access.

items.title: Equity in Teaching Next Gen XR Developers
items.content: This presentation discusses experiences and approaches to providing learning opportunities through Community Colleges. Topics include addressing obtaining hardware, preparing students for diverse workforces and obtaining funding to serve the community. The presenter also speaks about hurdles and approaches to providing affordable opportunities to students

items.title: Rebecca DuPont
items.content: For fifteen years, Dr. DuPont has taught multimedia communications across the greater Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania area. Her areas of focus include VR and AR, Web design and development along with Video Game design and development. Dr. DuPont continues to provide education in these areas through her position at Community College of Allegheny County. Her passions include providing opportunities to students and members of the community to gain hands-on experience with these cutting-edge technologies and providing Open Source Educational materials to encourage others to offer opportunities to their communities.

items.title: Administering XR Programs
items.content: As metaversities spring up and XR is increasingly adopted for education, policies, processes, and even organizational structures need to adapt to meet the opportunities and address new challenges. Here we examine actionable steps in constructing successful XR programs.

items.title: Karen Alexander
items.content:
Dr. Karen Alexander is a sought-after consultant on building immersive learning programs with extensive connections across the XR industry and academia. Her experience spans partnering with community organizations on giving children and youth the opportunity to create with XR tools, guiding higher ed institutions through the process of XR adoption, advising ed tech and XR startups, and, in her role as an immersive learning consultant with MetaVRse, pioneering the translation of of 2D training into 3D experiences for enterprise. 

Dr. Alexander is a co-founder of XR Women, a worldwide network of professionals that meet weekly in virtual worlds and where a distinguished list of XR industry speakers has appeared. As part of the team that produces The Polys - WebXR Awards, WebXR Summit Series, and MetaTr@versal, she has worked with some of the most influential thought leaders in spatial computing. Bringing her passion for metaverse literacy back to her academic roots, Dr. Alexander is host of the WebXR Education Summit, assembling a diverse array of practitioners to share knowledge on successful implementation of immersive learning. She is also a member of the Immersive Learning Research Network’s State of XR and Immersive Learning Expert Panel. 

Prior to her work in XR, Dr. Alexander was Dean of Junior and Senior Year programs at the women’s college at Rutgers University and Senior Editor of Signs: Journal of Women and Culture in Society. Her experience in higher education ranges across teaching, program design, journal editing, and college administration, with specializations in art, literature, film, and cultural production. Dr. Alexander is committed to women’s advancement and gender and racial equality and believes in a Humanity First approach to XR and the metaverse. She holds master’s degrees in English, Philosophy, and Issues in Modern Culture and earned her PhD. at the University of London.

items.title: Emily Sherwood
items.content:
Emily Sherwood is Director of Digital Scholarship and Studio X at University of Rochester’s River Campus Libraries. She is an alum of both the Council on Libraries and Information Resources (CLIR) Postdoctoral Fellowship Program and the EDUCAUSE/CLIR Leading Change Institute. With over a decade of experience helping faculty across disciplines incorporate technology in their teaching and research, Emily regularly collaborates with faculty, staff, and administrators at UR and beyond to develop experiential learning opportunities, increase digital literacy skills, and push the boundaries of how libraries support research and teaching through the use of technology.

Currently, she is building capacity for augmented and virtual reality at UR with the opening of Studio X, a hub for immersive technologies. Emily holds a doctorate in English from the Graduate Center of the City University of New York.

items.title: Heather Haseley
items.content:
Heather Haseley is the Co-Founder and Co-Executive Director of the Arizona State University Learning Futures and Lead Design Architect of Next Generation Learning.

At Learning Futures, we imagine and build the future of learning for all learners. Our goal is to create the conditions to foster creativity and collaboration to enhance learning. Faculty, students, and staff experience deeper empathy for all our learners by taking part in bold exploration and experimentation within a human-centered learning environment. Through our Collaboratory, Studios, and Emporium, we play, fail, learn and iterate through authentic collaboration. Our Learning Futures Collaboratory brings individuals, research, and communities together to imagine the future of learning and set a bold collective vision. Our Learning Futures Studios allow us to prototype and create POCs and MVPs for testing that inform the platforms, architectures, and infrastructure needed to scale our vision. Our studios are not full of professionals, rather groups of students who get paid to upskill in addition to working on meaningful projects for the institution and clients. Our platforms and products are made by students for students. Our Learning Futures Emporium allows everyone to access our tools, experience the future, and be inspired to co-create the future. Participants feel the excitement of positive growth and societal impact by contributing to the future of learning.

Before joining ASU, Heather served in leadership roles at the University of Pennsylvania, Northwestern University, and Columbia University fostering innovation in learning through the creation of new centers, programs, communities of practice, and learning experiences. She has presented at national and international conferences and events around the world on learning innovation, giving feedback, learning design, and program development.

items.title: Gamifying Immersive Learning
items.content: Design is key for all learning, and immersive learning is no exception. And gamification represents one strategy that can provide structure and enhance engagement in learning. This session explores immersive learning design strategies and why they matter.

items.title: Heather Dodds
items.content:
Heather Elizabeth Dodds, Ph.D. is a compassionate and enthusiastic research design advocate. She has current UX certifications and holds a Master’s Degree in e-Education from the University of Phoenix and a Doctorate in Instructional Design for Online Learning from Capella University. Heather\'s 2013 dissertation is on the quantitative effects of virtual worlds (Second Life) on scientific inquiry skills.

In the past two years, Heather has authored two book chapters, one on the use of XR in STEM education and one for instructional designers guiding the use of XR in higher education. Recently, she also taught one of the first college courses ever to incorporate the Quest 2 headset. She actively publishes about the design and use of XR for learning via LinkedIn and her blog.

items.title: Aleshia Hayes
items.content:
Dr. Hayes is passionate about developing, evaluating, and iterating on technology used for learning in formal and informal environments. She has designed and created educational XR experiences over the past decade and works tirelessly to encourage students at all levels to pursue STEM education and STEM careers with the explicit goal of expanding and diversifying STEM education and the STEM workforce. Her efforts to recruit students into STEM range from public exhibits of Virtual Reality, to K12 classroom visits, to app development camps for middle and high school-aged students to hosting interdisciplinary game development events.

Dr. Hayes leverages her research funded by NSF, NIH, the Department of Defense and the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation to inform Learning Technology design and implementation across learners from K12 and university levels to the workforce.

items.title: Brooke Morrill
items.content:
Dr. Brooke Morrill serves as the Senior Director of Education at Schell Games. Morrill uses her expertise in behavioral science, psychology, and research to increase the impact of and engagement in the company’s educational and transformational games. She identifies and secures extramural project funding in both the federal and private sectors in order to create and iteratively develop innovative, interactive experiences. In addition, she collaborates with universities and research institutions for product development and evaluation. She also maintains an active Board Certified Behavior Analyst-Doctoral credential from the Behavior Analyst Certification Board.

Morrill’s noteworthy contributions at Schell Games include securing and managing governmental funding for projects including Happy Atoms, HoloLAB Champions, and most recently HistoryMaker VR, all of which are funded through federal grants. Outside of the studio, Morrill serves on the XR Education and Training Advisory Group for the Academy of International Extended Reality (AIXR), a membership network of industry leaders that helps to enable growth, nurture talent, and develop standards while working to bring wider public awareness and understanding to virtual and augmented reality. She is also a Principal Member of grant review panels for the Institute of Education Sciences at the US Department of Education.

Prior to working at Schell Games, Morrill gained a variety of experiences through her educational endeavors. While earning her PhD at Utah State University, she became a summer intern at Disney Research Pittsburgh in the Behavioral Economics Research lab. While there, she met Schell Games’ CEO Jesse Schell and began working at the company soon after.

Morrill currently lives north of Pittsburgh, with her husband, children, and dogs. During her free time, she enjoys cooking, being a theater patron, and counting down to the holiday season.

items.title: Stylianos Mystakidis
items.content:
Dr. Stylianos Mystakidis is a Learning Innovator and Researcher at the University of Patras, Greece, as well as Professor-Counselor at the Hellenic Open University, Greece. His areas of professional expertise and research are Learning Innovation, Metaverse, Virtual Reality, Augmented Reality, Gamification, Serious Games, Open Education and Continuous Professional Development. He has published over 60 articles in peer-reviewed international journals, conference proceedings and books on the previous topics.

He has extensive teaching experience in European (Spain, United Kingdom, Greece, Cyprus) and US universities. In 2020, he co-designed and developed as lead author the official 2-ECTS blended learning course for all educators of Cyprus on “Augmented and Virtual Reality in Teaching and Learning”. He has also designed, developed and managed an innovative, awarded-winning MOOC using playful design and Multiuser Virtual Worlds. He has participated as certified project manager (PMP) and researcher in eleven international projects.

His formal studies include a Ph.D. at the Faculty of Information Technology, University of Jyväskylä (Finland), a MA in Education in Virtual Worlds at the University of West of England Bristol (United Kingdom), a MSc in Mechanical Engineering at the National Technical University of Athens (Greece) and a Postgraduate Certificate at the Open University of Catalonia (Spain).
List of publications: https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Stylianos-Mystakidis

items.title: XR in Medical Education
items.content: Medical training is one of the most important use cases in XR, because it gives students and healthcare professionals immersive access to realistic healthcare scenarios, without posing risks to live patients, and without requiring the extensive resources needed for re-enactment in a live clinical training setting on a per learner basis. From operating medical machines to understanding patient perspectives, immersive learning programs are more effective and economical than traditional 2D modalities. Hear from leading experts in immersive medical education.

items.title: Christi Fenison
items.content:
Christi Fenison is an immersive storyteller, 3D artist, 360 videographer and simulation designer.
Her passion is creating XR experiences that expand perspectives and inspire action. Drawing on principles of narrative transport, cognitive elaboration and the sense of presence, she works to bring big picture ideas to life via the careful interplay of meaningful details.

By day, Christi works as an XR Instructional Media Producer at UNC School of Medicine IT, focused on the research, development and integration of XR training simulations in curriculum. Beyond the classroom, she is also a bespoke World Builder for Social VR events, crafting custom experiences tailored to each client’s vision and goals.

Christi received her Master's degree from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill’s Environment and Science Communication program, where focused on Emerging Technologies, 3D Modeling + Unity Development, Green Architecture + Sustainable Design, Geospatial Information Systems, and Immersive Journalism.

items.title: William P. Levin, MD
items.content:
Dr. Levin is an Associate Clinical Professor and the Medical Director of Global Network Operations in the Department of Radiation Oncology at the University of Pennsylvania’s Abramson Cancer Center. He received his undergraduate degree from Franklin & Marshall College, a master’s degree in physiology from Georgetown University, and an undergraduate medical degree from Tel Aviv University. His post-graduate training includes an internship in medicine at Yale University, a residency in radiation oncology at the University of Pennsylvania, and a fellowship in proton therapy at the Massachusetts General Hospital.

Dr. Levin’s clinical focus is the management of patients with thoracic malignancies and soft tissue sarcomas. His research interests include investigation of integrative oncology modalities and mind-body medicine. Dr. Levin is a nationally and internationally recognized leader in the development of virtual reality applications for healthcare.

items.title: Bringing Immersive Education to Underserved Communities
items.content: "The Digital Divide" hasn't been solved yet to provide equitable access to the internet, let alone immersive education. This panel will explore what it will take to accelerate the equitable delivery of Immersive Education to the underprivileged communities so that teachers and students have the access, exposure, and opportunity to take advantage of the best of today's tools.

items.title: Clayton Banks
items.content:
Tedx and Global speaker. Experienced Executive with strong leadership and strategic skills. Recently recognized as the 2013 "Business Person of the Year" by the Harlem Business Alliance for implementing innovative strategies for non-profit and for profit clients and exceeding objectives.

Skilled in content, technology, brand development, multimedia, online web and multiplatform production, for domestic and international operations. A track record of positive results in P&L management, multi-channel distribution, product launches, new market recognition, and growing the bottom-line while motivating an accomplished staff in a dynamic business environment.

items.title: Shannon Putman
items.content:
My name is Shannon Putman, PhD-Fort Knox Coordinate in the Education Leadership Evaluation and Org. Development Department at the University of Louisville. Prior to that, I spent eight years teaching the multi-modal communication special education classroom and two years as the learning and behavior disorder resource teacher. I spent three years working as the teacher in residence at Cochran Elementary. I have focused my work on implementing the use of Immersive Virtual Reality (IVR) technologies into the educational curriculum. My Ph.D. research focused on the use of IVR technology as educational interventions.

I am also an advisory board member of XReps, the leading immersive virtual reality football simulation system.

items.title: Angelina Dayton
items.content: Dr. Angelina Dayton is the Chief Research Scientist at the Virtual World Society and an Aspen Institute Tech Policy Fellow. She has previously been an XR user-experience designer, speaker, consultant and trainer.  She is widely known as The VR Lady and has spent her career helping those in education and industry understand large-scale deployment and mass adoption of emerging technologies. She is the mother of seven and is a children’s magician in her free time.

items.title: Building Community Among XR Educators
items.content: Co-founders of Educators in VR Lorelle von Fossen and Daniel Dyboski-Bryant have extensive experience bringing people together in VR to share their knowledge and experience of  XR education. Here they will discuss what they have gleaned from the hundreds of events they’ve produced.

items.title: Daniel Dyboski-Bryant
items.content:
Daniel Dyboski-Bryant is a humanitarian committed to XR for good. His personal mission is to explore, drive and share the development and application of benevolent and meaningful and impactful experiences with emerging technologies. 

Daniel is the Executive Director of the Virtual World Society - a US non-profit - leading their mission to inspire and enable people to thrive, solve problems and create positive impact with emerging technologies. Since 2015, the VWS has run projects around the globe with families, schools and communities; has recognised and celebrated achievements in the XR community; and has contributed thought leadership to the industry.

Daniel co-founded Educators in VR in 2018 to bring together a global community of 3500 educators pioneering the integration of VR for learning, teaching and beyond. He specializes in R.I.S.E. - Remote Immersive Synchronous Experiences and Education. Educators in VR has run more than 3000 virtual events, workshops, presentations and conferences. In Feb 2020, two weeks before Covid 19 arrived, Educators in VR hosted the 2020 International Educators in VR Summit - a 6-day, 24/7, fully immersive VR conference on 5 platforms with 170 speakers, 150 events and 95% CO2 saving compared with a real-world conference. In May 2021 they ran a similar 30-day conference on 20 immersive VR platforms. Daniel will host the WebXR Production Summit on October 13.

Daniel has been an educator for 25 years, teaching languages, entrepreneurship and innovation and training trainers at colleges, universities and corporations in Germany, England, Wales and online. At Coleg Menai Daniel built and led an immersive learning Lab where he used VR to engage with migrant workers and refugees for which he won Inspire Tutor of the Year award in 2020.

items.title: Lorelle Van Fossen
items.content: Co-founder and Director of Educators in VR, Lorelle is an educator, keynote, trainer, and passionate advocate for immersive technology. Considered an evangelist, she teaches dozens of workshops and classes annually focused on integrating immersive technology into schools, businesses, and life. Lorelle is an author and writer and expert on social media, web publishing, and VR education.

items.title: Emilie Joly
items.content: Emilie is the CEO and Co-Founder of Zoe Immersive. Based in Los Angeles and Geneva, Switzerland, she oversees business strategy for the company, and was pivotal to establishing Zoe partnerships with Unity, Meta, Qualcomm, Epic Games, and others. Emilie is a Swiss designer & technologist at heart, specializing in human-computer interactions. Emilie’s ultimate goal is to empower the next generations to become creators in the metaverse.

items.title: Sage Freeman
items.content: I am an Instructional Media Specialist working at Chemeketa Community College in the Center for Academic Innovation on a faculty support team. I specialize in instructional media and work with faculty on content creation, use of technology and media, best practices and pedagogical use of media, media enabled classroom technology, and more. My former professional background was in video game development prior to working in higher education.

items.title: Safety, Privacy, and Ethical Design in XR for Education
items.content: XR technologies are powerful tools with enormous potential to transform education. Yet these technologies also come with considerable risks. This panel will explore delve into philosophical and ethical issues surrounding the use of XR with young people and will address ways to ensure safety, privacy, and human dignity.

items.title: Karen Alexander
items.content:
Dr. Karen Alexander is a sought-after consultant on building immersive learning programs with extensive connections across the XR industry and academia. Her experience spans partnering with community organizations on giving children and youth the opportunity to create with XR tools, guiding higher ed institutions through the process of XR adoption, advising ed tech and XR startups, and, in her role as an immersive learning consultant with MetaVRse, pioneering the translation of of 2D training into 3D experiences for enterprise. 

Dr. Alexander is a co-founder of XR Women, a worldwide network of professionals that meet weekly in virtual worlds and where a distinguished list of XR industry speakers has appeared. As part of the team that produces The Polys - WebXR Awards, WebXR Summit Series, and MetaTr@versal, she has worked with some of the most influential thought leaders in spatial computing. Bringing her passion for metaverse literacy back to her academic roots, Dr. Alexander is host of the WebXR Education Summit, assembling a diverse array of practitioners to share knowledge on successful implementation of immersive learning. She is also a member of the Immersive Learning Research Network’s State of XR and Immersive Learning Expert Panel. 

Prior to her work in XR, Dr. Alexander was Dean of Junior and Senior Year programs at the women’s college at Rutgers University and Senior Editor of Signs: Journal of Women and Culture in Society. Her experience in higher education ranges across teaching, program design, journal editing, and college administration, with specializations in art, literature, film, and cultural production. Dr. Alexander is committed to women’s advancement and gender and racial equality and believes in a Humanity First approach to XR and the metaverse. She holds master’s degrees in English, Philosophy, and Issues in Modern Culture and earned her PhD. at the University of London.

items.title: Peta Estens
items.content: Peta is an experienced teacher, researcher and award-winning digital designer specialising in immersive technologies. She designed Pangaea Minds, an educational framework using virtual worlds to connect schools for global team-teaching and student collaboration. Peta has recently led the design of VR and AR solutions for NSW Transport and the Music Performance Industry. Her research in Immersive Design at UNSW was a catalyst for her strong interest in ethics, regulation, and governance specific to the metaverse. She is the Director of XR Global Citizenship and Education at XRSI.org and is currently studying Cyber Law at Deakin University. As a classroom teacher, she is committed to empowering teachers, parents, and students in their understanding of the opportunities, challenges, and risks associated with belonging to virtual worlds and the metaverse. Peta is also winner of the 2021 Immersive Learning Research Network: Best Immersive Learning Project. Pangaea Minds is a truly innovative and global approach to equip students with the attitude and aptitude for conquering the serious economic, political, health, and climate challenges our current leaders are grappling with.

items.title: Rolando Masís-Obando
items.content:
Rolando Masís-Obando is a PhD candidate of Computational Neuroscience at Princeton University. Scientifically, he is interested in how contexts (like those in VR/AR) shape the way we think and remember our day-to-day experiences. He has scanned dozens of people’s brains (and effectively read their minds) to further understand how the brain represents spaces and concepts. Given the intersection of AR/VR with neuroscience, Rolando’s recent interests revolve around how we can shape a future internet to be more human-centered and grounded under ethical principles. He recently directed a cinematic educational video on the history of the Metaverse and its ongoing issues with privacy and agency. The video can be found here: https://youtu.be/wsJF1ugsfKI

Rolando graduated from Yale University with a focus on Molecular, Cellular and Developmental Biology. During his studies co-founded Shuflix with his brothers, the largest activity search engine (at the time), to help people interact with their environment in a playful alternative way while helping small businesses get more exposure. Since then, he has also co-founded PhDx, a platform to help incoming PhD students with guides and insider knowledge of the unspoken rules in academia.

In his free time, Rolando is a filmmaker, composes for films, creates augmented reality tutorials for his YouTube channel, and does pro-bono marketing consulting for personal brands and small businesses.

items.title: Teaching in Virtual Campuses and Classrooms
items.content: When the rules of time and physics don’t apply, you can teach anywhere at any moment in history and take the students with you. We’ll hear from teachers who are also world builders on what they’ve learned while teaching in VR.

items.title: Keith Chan
items.content: Keith earned a Ph.D. in anthropology and used it to make a career introducing students to this field. After trying VR, he saw its potential in education and began making the VR museum AnVRopomotron to enhance the student experience. He continues to investigate ways that XR can enrich learning.

items.title: Michael Avis
items.content:
Michael has worked in the educational sector for over twenty years and has taught at the primary, secondary, college, and university levels both domestically and internationally. He is currently working to motivate and facilitate college faculty in increasing digital literacy, exploring new practices, and investigating experiential and extended reality learning opportunities at the Teaching and Learning Exchange at George Brown College.

In addition, he is the president and founder of Tapvigo Solutions, an innovative communications solutions company. In his work, Michael has helped to create a groundbreaking virtual reality simulation on anti-racism called Let\'s Talk About Race.

items.title: Andrew Wright
items.content: Andrew Wright is the director and Lead Education Consultant at iTeacher, Creator of the EDUmetaverse. With 25 years classroom experience he is an international speaker and innovations specialist, based in Sydney. For the last 8 months he has been building worlds and teaching in the Metaverse.

items.title: Adaptive Transformation
items.content: Summit co-host Julie Smithson synthesizes the key takeaways from the WebXR Education Summit, making sense out of what we learned, and talks about building digital mindsets in organizations. That starts with how people need to continuously adapt to the evolving needs of their jobs in order to seize new opportunities.

items.title: Julie Smithson
items.content:
Julie Smithson’s personal mission is to ‘inspire and educate people to think and act in a socially, economically and environmentally responsible way’.

It is through this lens as co-founder at MetaVRse, a 3D Web game engine for Business & XR development company.  Julie is leading enterprise companies to digitally transform and educate ways to immersive and remotely train users of the product/service. Julie guides her team to translate instructional language, interaction behaviors and curate knowledge testing gamification for businesses.  

Julie’s leadership is focused on transforming training & marketing into immersive experiences using technologies to design Web3 solutions, integration implementation and deployment to produce growth benefits, cost savings and human efficiencies.

Julie is also co-Chair of XRWomen.com , a global group of women who meet every Wednesday and learn about the applications of extended realities.  The group works to advocate, inspire and build communities aimed at inclusivity of gender equality, race and ethnicity in the digital sector and beyond.  

Julie is the host of the XR For Learning podcast. Julie also leads XR Collaboration, a coalition supporting human connectivity through digital presence in platforms building communication and collaboration.  Julie is also founder of XR Ignite to support the innovation and entrepreneurship of our communities. She also sits on panels and in leading conversations about interoperability standards and alignments with Khronos Group and MetaTr@versal.  

Previous to MetaVRse, Julie was Co-Founder of Emulator, the World’s most advanced DJ system, which won the prestigious 2011 DJ Mag Innovative Product Award.  She scored a $500K deal on the hit TV show Dragons’ Den. 

Julie is the co-host of the WebXR Summit series and a renowned speaker on XR and Produced TEDx Toronto (2010) and introduced coding in VR at Canada Learns Code (2017). She is past-President of the VRARA Toronto Chapter and Former Chair of the VRARA Education and Student Committees. Most recently Julie presented with the YPO, Harvard and 1Society about changing the way we learn and teach using spatial technologies.

items.title: Findings on the Effectiveness of XR for Education
items.content: The evidence for the effectiveness of XR in learning is more than anecdotal. These researchers represent the cutting edge of those whose work can show us what really works.

items.title: Karen Alexander
items.content:
Dr. Karen Alexander is a sought-after consultant on building immersive learning programs with extensive connections across the XR industry and academia. Her experience spans partnering with community organizations on giving children and youth the opportunity to create with XR tools, guiding higher ed institutions through the process of XR adoption, advising ed tech and XR startups, and, in her role as an immersive learning consultant with MetaVRse, pioneering the translation of of 2D training into 3D experiences for enterprise. 

Dr. Alexander is a co-founder of XR Women, a worldwide network of professionals that meet weekly in virtual worlds and where a distinguished list of XR industry speakers has appeared. As part of the team that produces The Polys - WebXR Awards, WebXR Summit Series, and MetaTr@versal, she has worked with some of the most influential thought leaders in spatial computing. Bringing her passion for metaverse literacy back to her academic roots, Dr. Alexander is host of the WebXR Education Summit, assembling a diverse array of practitioners to share knowledge on successful implementation of immersive learning. She is also a member of the Immersive Learning Research Network’s State of XR and Immersive Learning Expert Panel. 

Prior to her work in XR, Dr. Alexander was Dean of Junior and Senior Year programs at the women’s college at Rutgers University and Senior Editor of Signs: Journal of Women and Culture in Society. Her experience in higher education ranges across teaching, program design, journal editing, and college administration, with specializations in art, literature, film, and cultural production. Dr. Alexander is committed to women’s advancement and gender and racial equality and believes in a Humanity First approach to XR and the metaverse. She holds master’s degrees in English, Philosophy, and Issues in Modern Culture and earned her PhD. at the University of London.

items.title: Cassondra Eng
items.content: Cassondra (Cassie) Eng is an NIH T32 Sports Neuroscience Postdoctoral Scholar at Stanford University. Her training is in two distinct, but complementary areas: the Learning Sciences and Cognitive Neuroscience. She utilizes eye tracking and neuroimaging to investigate the interactions between psychophysiological processes and educational outcomes. Her research focuses on fostering attention regulation and cognitive skills through enriching virtual learning contexts. Her primary work examines how physically-active video games enhance cognitive development and neuroplasticity in at-risk populations. As technology use grows at an exponential rate and sedentary behavior increases in the wake of the global pandemic, evidence-based practices that promote both physical activity and cognitive engagement are needed. She advocates for Educational Neuroscience, the emerging field that fosters collaborations in neuroscience, psychology, human-computer interaction, educational technology, and related disciplines to explore how learning experiences support brain development and cognitive skills crucial for academic achievement and success.

items.title: Eleni Mangina
items.content:
Eleni Mangina carried out her PhD work at the University of Strathclyde (UK), Department of Electronic and Electrical Engineering, working on Agent-based applications for intelligent data interpretation (1998-2001). Eleni Mangina holds an M.Sc. in Artificial Intelligence from the Department of Artificial Intelligence at University of Edinburgh in the UK and an MSc in Agricultural Science from Agricultural University of Athens in Greece. In 2002 she joined the School of Computer Science, at University College Dublin, Ireland.

Dr Eleni Mangina is currently Professor at the School of Computer Science, University College Dublin in Ireland and the Vice Principal (International) for College of Science. Eleni Mangina is guided by her own definition of the art of persistence, that involves both courage and compassion with research integrity and authenticity. Her lab operates at the intersection between applied Artificial Intelligence (VR/AR; Data Analytics; UAVs; Information Systems) and a portfolio development within interdisciplinary applications (i.e. Energy Sector and Educational Systems with XR).

Eleni Mangina has extensive experience for the last 20 years in National, EU and International funded projects and she is project coordinator of two (2) H2020 projects (ARETE & AHA), one (1) Erasmus+KA2 (FANTASIA) and partner within other H2020 projects (i.e. iSEED) and three (3) Erasmus+ projects (XRforPed, BASE, RoboPisces). She is funded investigator as part of SFI Energy Systems Integration Partnership Programme (ESIPP), NEXSYS and academic supervisor for two (2) SFI Centres for Research Training (CRT) (Machine Learning – ML-Labs; Digitally-Enhanced Reality – D-REAL).

She has authored more than 200 peer-reviewed articles in national and international peer reviewed workshops and conferences and international journals, including in IEEE and ACM. Eleni Mangina also contributes as a committee member for reviews to many international conferences and journals. Eleni Mangina also contributes actively to IEEE Standards and is the Executive Editor for the publications of the IEEE Global Initiative on XR Ethics. She is currently the Chair of Athena SWAN Bronze Award application for the School of Computer Science.

items.title: Nigel Newbutt
items.content: I am an Assistant Professor in the College of Education, at the University of Florida and have experience of developing technologies with autistic, and underserved groups, which started in my undergraduate work exploring multimedia programs for a deaf community in the U.K. I am currently interested in examining and developing the role that VR HMDs can play in supporting young people with autism in their daily lives; informed by their input. The aim of my work is to co-design the future of this field (VR and autism) with autistic communities and other important stakeholders. More than this, I am also interested in developing a range of innovative technologies that can help to enable people with neuro-diversity.

items.title: Enterprise Case Study: Siemens Healthineers
items.content: International medical equipment manufacturer Siemens Healthineers are remaking their employee education program using WebXR. Sophia meets with Jennifer Crawford to talk about how the scalability of delivering immersive content over the web enables rapid expansion with measurable results.

items.title: Sophia Moshasha
items.content:
Sophia Moshasha is on a mission to accelerate the adoption of immersive & emerging technologies. Behind the scenes, on camera, and on stage, Sophia is a driving force behind numerous initiatives designed to advance knowledge and engagement with XR across all sectors.

As a producer of The Polys - WebXR Awards and host of its Virtual Red Carpet, Special Correspondent of the WebXR Summit Series and co-host of the VRARA podcast, Sophia has interviewed dozens of XR pioneers and innovators. As a fellow of MetaTr@versal, an initiative to advocate for cooperation among the stakeholders of the Metaverse on standards and interoperability, Sophia was the star of a 40 minute, 3-act play which was performed live on the Main Stage at AWE 2022, which featured a cast of industry heavyweights. She is a co-founder of XR Women, a global collective dedicated to the advancement of female representation in technology.  Sophia will host the WebXR Brand Summit on September 15.

Since 2018, Sophia has been the Vice President of the DC Chapter of the VR/AR Association’s Washington, D.C. Chapter. Sophia is also the co-founder and Chief Marketing Officer for Ready Player Golf, the first annual Virtual Reality Charity Golf Outing, which began in 2020, and has raised money for MSF (Doctors Without Borders) and XRSI (the XR Safety Initiative). She has served as Head of Partnerships for Brightline Interactive, XR Strategist for Virtual Reality Marketing, and in Executive Program support for AFWERX, the US Air Force’s Innovation Investment Program. 


Sophia has been influencing global networks through many years of active engagement in the XR community. She has been featured on prominent media outlets such as Forbes, ABC, CGTN, American Dream TV series and more She holds a Bachelor of Science from Virginia Commonwealth University. She is currently engaged in public policy planning for Meta.

items.title: Jennifer Crawford
items.content:
Jennifer has been with Siemens Healthineers for 13 years in various roles most recent is as Global Head of Education Designers. In that role she is responsible for design of development of internal training on Healthcare Products.

She lives in Pittsboro, NC currently with her husband & son both named James and her dog Taz.
Jen enjoys coaching little league and basketball in her spare time and spending time on the lake.

items.title: Classroom Case Study – The Magic of Flight
items.content: The Magic of Flight swept its categories at The Polys - WebXR Awards winning Video Experience, Education Experience, and Experience of the Year trophies . Sophia Moshasha interviews John Collins, who has more than 30 years experience in STEM education, on how immersive makes teaching science a dream come true.

items.title: Sophia Moshasha
items.content:
Sophia Moshasha is on a mission to accelerate the adoption of immersive & emerging technologies. Behind the scenes, on camera, and on stage, Sophia is a driving force behind numerous initiatives designed to advance knowledge and engagement with XR across all sectors.

As a producer of The Polys - WebXR Awards and host of its Virtual Red Carpet, Special Correspondent of the WebXR Summit Series and co-host of the VRARA podcast, Sophia has interviewed dozens of XR pioneers and innovators. She has been featured on prominent media outlets such as Forbes, ABC, CGTN, American Dream TV series and more She holds a Bachelor of Science from Virginia Commonwealth University. She is currently engaged in public policy planning for Meta.

items.title: John Collins
items.content:
John Collins a.k.a. The Paper Airplane Guy held the world record holder for paper airplane distance for ten years. Author of five books of original designs, John has been called the world’s foremost expert on paper aircraft. He has appeared on Conan, Nat Geo, Discovery, Science Channel, ESPN’s Sports Science, Ripley’s Believe It or Not, as well as performing live for TedX Munich, Google Zeitgeist, WIRED 21, Harvard’s Graduate School of Design, and more than 90 in-person presentations per year.

If you've never seen a paper airplane flaps it's wings, flip over and fly back upside down, spin, circle, loop or stay aloft for minutes indoors; tighten your seat belt and stow your tray table. You’re cleared for takeoff!

items.title: About
items.content:
We are a catalyst for the

Advancement of the

Immersive Arts and Sciences

by Educating the Community

and Honoring Achievements

items.title: MetaTr@versal
items.content:
The MetaTr@versal Initiative is an independent advocacy fellowship that holds events designed to foster cooperation between the stakeholders of the Metaverse.

MetaTr@versal began in 2021 with a series of Zoom calls among industry leaders to express support for portal interoperablility across social XR platforms. This was followed up with a special 2-hour panel event, followed by a three-act play performed on the Main Stage at AWE in June of 2022. MetaTr@versal holds portal crawls between platforms to demonstrate the need for interoperability.

Founding Fellow Neil Trevett credits MetaTr@versal as being instrumental in the founding of the Metaverse Standards, which he chairs.

MetaTr@versal is created by Ben Erwin with founding Fellows Evo Heyning, Terry xR. Schussler, Neil Trevett, Daniel Dyboski-Bryant and Julie Smithson.

items.title: Lifetime Achievement
items.content: The Poly for Lifetime Achievement recognized profound achievements to the ecoystem.

items.title: P3C – Lifetime Achievement Award:
items.content:
Patrick Cozzi was honored on March 5, 2023 on the LED Volume at ZeroSpace in Brooklyn, New York for his work in developing the gtTF Specification. This award was both the first time a Poly was presented in- person, and presented in a Looking Glass Holographic display.

The award was presented by Shawn Frayne, CEO and Co-Founder of Looking Glass, along with a video where prior honoree, Brandon Jones who selected Patrick as his successor honored his work. This was followed by love from the community by Patrick's friends and colleagues Neil Trevett, Nadine Alameh, Damon Hernandez, and Tony Parisi.

items.title: Shawn Frayne
items.content:
Inspired by movies in the 80’s and 90’s, Shawn has been reaching towards the dream of the hologram for over 20 years. Shawn got his start with a classic laser interference pattern holographic studio he built in high school, followed by training in advanced holographic film techniques at MIT. He has been awarded dozens of patents around the world, the Popular Mechanics Breakthrough Award, and noted as one of the ‘20 Best Brains Under 40’ by Discover Magazine.

Shawn works between Brooklyn and Hong Kong where he serves as co-founder and CEO of Looking Glass Factory.

items.title: Brandon Jones
items.content: Brandon is a software engineer at Google working on various ways to bring immersive content to the web, including WebGL, WebXR, and most recently WebGPU.

items.title: 2021 – Lifetime Achievement
items.content:
The Poly for Lifetime Achivement honors individuals who have made invaluable contributions to the WebXR Stack.

We are honoring Brandon Jones for his work in bringing excellence in 3D Graphics to the Web through WebVR, WebXR and WebGPU. Thank you Brandon for everything you have done to help accelerate this medium for web developers to deliver immersive experiences through browsers.

items.title: Brandon Jones
items.content: Brandon is a software engineer at Google working on various ways to bring immersive content to the web, including WebGL, WebXR, and most recently WebGPU.

items.title: Jacquelyn Morie
items.content:
Jacquelyn Morie is a pioneer in the domains of computer graphics and virtual reality. She is the founder of All These Worlds, LLC, a company that creates and supports Virtual World experiences and research. Her clients have included NASA, the University of Southern California’s Institute for Creative Technologies (USC/ICT), XPRIZE and the Army Medical Command.

Her ongoing research focuses on how immersion can affect and benefit participants, how the use of Avatars changes both our social connections and our deep understanding of our sense of self, and how multisensory elements combine to create a cognitive gestalt that enhances the feelings of Presence in virtual experiences.

Her 2007 PhD thesis – Meaning and Emplacement in Expressive Immersive Virtual Environments – has been downloaded hundreds of times by emerging VR communities, serving as a deep first introduction and guide to the many important aspects of this new medium, from its female-centric history to a design methodology for emotional impact. It was completed under the supervision of Dr Lizbeth Goodman at the SMARTlab Digital Media Institute University College Dublin, Ireland.

Dr Morie is a long time educator, having created digital programs at the University of Central Florida, the Ringling College of Art and Design, and Otis College of Art and Design. She is the original developer of the first computer animation training program for Walt Disney Feature Animation in the 1990s, as well as similar training programs for companies in the Digital Effects industries, such as Rhythm and Hues Studios. She is a former member of the DARPA ISAT Group, tasked with investigating new topics for DARPA research, and a founder of the USC/ICT, where she served as Senior Scientist for 14 years. She is a three decades member of ACM SIGGRAPH and has served that organization in many capacities over the years.

items.title: Ricardo Cabello – Mr. Doob
items.content:
Ricardo (@mrdoob) is a self-taught computer-graphics programmer. Originally from Barcelona, he began his professional career alternating between roles as a designer and developer. In his spare time, his involvement in the demoscene set him on the path to learning graphics programming.

Combining his background as a designer and expertise in development, his work ranges from simple interactive digital toys — Google Gravity, Ball Pool and Harmony — to full featured experiences — The Johnny Cash Project, The Wilderness Downtown and ROME.

Nowadays, Ricardo spends most of his time developing open source libraries and tools — three.js, frame.js and stats.js — with the aim of making design and development simpler for everyone.

items.title: Trevor Flowers
items.content: For over twenty years I have turned ideas into products in a variety of technical organizations ranging from low level systems programming (Be) to high level ubiquitous computing research (Xerox PARC). I have found success in many roles in growth startups including individual contributor and CTO.

items.title: Evo Heyning
items.content:
Evo Heyning has been creating immersive experiences that bridge real and virtual worlds for more than 20 years. As an interactive showrunner and production strategist, she has worked on media projects ranging from launching the Affordable Care Act to producing more than 500 hours of livestreaming events during the pandemic. Her work focuses on metaverse media and the creative potential of volumetric and virtual production.

Evo passionately shapes the future of the open spatial web to connect people and groundbreaking, applicable ideas through collaborative technologies. Through her company Playable Agency, Evo provides early stage production strategy and creative worldbuilding that expand reality.

items.title: 2021 – WebXR Community Award
items.content:
The WebXR Community Award honors outstanding contributions in sharing information about WebXR.

We are honoring Trevor for his dedication to supporting the WebXR Community through the W3C Community Group, Immersive Web Weekly, as host of the WebXR Developer Summit, and via social media. Thank you Trevor. We love you.

items.title: Trevor Flowers
items.content: For over twenty years I have turned ideas into products in a variety of technical organizations ranging from low level systems programming (Be) to high level ubiquitous computing research (Xerox PARC). I have found success in many roles in growth startups including individual contributor and CTO.

items.title: Jacob Rossi
items.content: Jacob is the Product Manager for the web platform at Oculus, leading the product development of Oculus Browser, WebXR, and Progressive Web Apps for all of Oculus's VR devices. Jacob has helping develop browsers, web standards, and developer tools at Microsoft, the W3C, and Oculus for over 12 years.

items.title: Dave Hill
items.content:
Hi, I'm Dave Hill. I'm an Engineering Manager at Oculus/Facebook Reality Labs, supporting the Oculus Browser team and focusing on the web developer ecosystem as it relates to our headsets and our browser. Prior to joining Oculus, I spent time at Microsoft working on HoloLens, and on Xbox Kinect before that.

Before that, I spent a bunch of years working in game development working on gameplay, graphics, and engine programming.

items.title: Ombudsperson of the Year
items.content: The Mantle of Ombudsperson of the Year goes to those whose work promotes public mindfulness of safety, ethics and privacy in XR.

items.title: Avi Bar-Zeev
items.content:
Avi Bar-Zeev has been at the forefront of XR and The Metaverse for over 30 years: first launching Disney’s groundbreaking Aladdin VR ride in the early 90s, crafting Second Life’s 3D worlds and co-founding Keyhole (Google Earth) mirror-earth 3D browser around 2001. He co-invented Microsoft Hololens in 2010, helped defined Amazon Echo Frames in 2015, and then contributed at Apple on undisclosed projects.

Since leaving Apple, he’s consulted privately for top XR companies and investors. And he’s taken a more public stance by writing and speaking publicly on important issues like privacy, biometric sensing and mental autonomy, targeted and future experiential advertising, DEI and harassment in XR, and various open Metaverse/web3 architectures.

Most recently, he is a founder and President of The XR Guild, a new non-profit membership organization that seeks to support and educate professionals in XR on ethics and most positive outcomes for humanity.

items.title: 2021 – Ombudsperson of the Year
items.content:
The Ombudsperson Award honors achievement in promoting public awareness of philosophical, ethical and human rights issue in XR.

As a veteran engineer and pioneer in XR, Avi Bar-Zeev has consistently presented thoughtful reflections on the impact of advanced technologies. Thank you Avi for expanding our perspective to keep these tools in service of humanity, without becoming a cookbook.

items.title: Kent Bye
items.content:
Since May 2014, Kent Bye has conducted over 1600 Voices of VR podcast interviews featuring the pioneering artists, storytellers, and technologists driving the resurgence of virtual & augmented reality. He's an oral historian, experiential journalist, & aspiring philosopher, helping to define the patterns of immersive storytelling, experiential design, ethical frameworks, & the ultimate potential of XR.

He's also been an executive committee member on the IEEE's Global Initiative on the Ethics of Extended Reality, which has been looking at mapping out the landscape of ethics for virtual and augmented reality. You can hear his latest thoughts on Twitter @kentbye.
